longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: An Ordinance to provide for certain payment systems for funds or securities to be subject to oversight by the Monetary Authority; for the supervision of stored value facilities by the Monetary Authority; for the modification of the laws of Hong Kong in their application to transactions effected through and proceedings within certain clearing and settlement systems so as to ensure finality as regards those transactions and proceedings; and for related purposes.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Short title

subsection.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Payment Systems and Stored Value Facilities Ordinance. (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 4)

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: accounts (帳目) means any accounts, whether kept in writing or print or by a machine or device; (Added 18 of 2015 s. 5)
Advisor (顧問), in relation to a licensee, means the person appointed to be an Advisor of the licensee under section 8ZG(1)(b) or 8ZX(2)(a); (Added 18 of 2015 s. 5)
bank (銀行) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155); (Added 18 of 2015 s. 5)
banking licence (銀行牌照) means a licence granted under section 16 of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155); (Added 18 of 2015 s. 5)
book-entry securities (記帳證券) means any securities issued under any law transferable by a book-entry (whether on a register or of any other kind);
certificate of finality (終局性證明書) means a certificate issued by the Monetary Authority under section 16(3);
Chairman of the Tribunal (審裁處主席) means the person appointed as such under section 34(3);

def.name: ClearingAndSettlementSystem
def.leadIn: clearing and settlement system (結算及交收系統) means a system established for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the clearing or settlement of payment obligations; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the clearing or settlement of obligations for the transfer of book-entry securities, or the transfer of such securities;

section.def: collateral security (附屬抵押品), in relation to a clearing and settlement system, means any realizable assets provided, whether under a charge or a re-purchase or similar agreement or otherwise (including money provided under a charge), for the purpose of securing rights and obligations potentially arising in connection with participation in the system;
declared medium of exchange (經宣布兌換媒介) means a thing that is declared to be a medium of exchange under section 2C; (Added 18 of 2015 s. 5)

def.name: DefaultArrangements
def.leadIn: default arrangements (違責處理安排), in relation to a payment system, means the arrangements in place within the system for limiting systemic and other types of risk in the event of a participant appearing to be, or likely to become, unable to meet his obligations in respect of a transfer order; and, without affecting the generality of the foregoing, includes any arrangements for— (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 5)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the netting of obligations owed to or by the participant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the closing out of open positions held by the participant; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the realizing of collateral security securing obligations owed by the participant;

section.def: defaulting participant (違責參與者), in relation to a clearing and settlement system, means a participant in respect of whom action has been taken by the system operator or settlement institution under the system’s default arrangements;
designated clearing and settlement system (指定結算及交收系統) means a clearing and settlement system designated under section 4(1); (Added 18 of 2015 s. 5)
designated retail payment system (指定零售支付系統) means a retail payment system designated under section 4(1); (Added 18 of 2015 s. 5)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a designated clearing and settlement system; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a designated retail payment system; (Replaced 18 of 2015 s. 5)

section.def: directors’ voluntary winding up statement (董事自動清盤陳述書) means a statement made under section 228A of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32), and a reference to such a statement taking effect is a reference to it being delivered for registration as specified in section 228A(3) of that Ordinance; (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920; 14 of 2016 s. 187)

disposition of property (財產產權處置), in the context of a disposition made to or by a participant in a designated system, includes a payment made to or by the participant in the designated system or in a clearing and settlement system, wherever located, that is utilized by the designated system to effect payments;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a payment system—see section 8(2);

paragraph.name: b

section.def: facilitate (促進)—see section 2B; (Added 18 of 2015 s. 5)
facilitator (促進人) means a person who facilitates the issue of a stored value facility in the manner as mentioned in section 2B; (Added 18 of 2015 s. 5)

def.name: Float
def.leadIn: float (儲值金額), in relation to a stored value facility issued, or the issue of which is facilitated, under a licence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: means the stored value remaining on the facility; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not include any SVF deposit; (Added 18 of 2015 s. 5)

section.def: investigator (調查員) means a person directed under section 33B(2)(a), or appointed under section 33B(2)(b), to carry out an investigation under Part 3A; (Added 18 of 2015 s. 5)
issue (發行), in relation to a stored value facility, includes the operation of the facility by the issuer for use by the user of the facility after its issue; (Added 18 of 2015 s. 5)

def.name: Issuer
def.leadIn: issuer (發行人), in relation to a stored value facility, means the person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: issues the facility; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: gives, in respect of the facility, an undertaking as specified in section 2A(2) or (3); (Added 18 of 2015 s. 5)

section.def: licence (牌照) means a licence granted under section 8F, or regarded as granted under section 8G; (Added 18 of 2015 s. 5)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person to whom a licence is granted under section 8F; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a bank that is regarded as being granted a licence under section 8G; (Added 18 of 2015 s. 5)

section.def: Manager (管理人), in relation to a licensee, means the person appointed to be a Manager of the licensee under section 8ZH(1)(b) or 8ZX(2)(a); (Added 18 of 2015 s. 5)
minimum criteria (最低準則) means the criteria set out in Part 2 of Schedule 3; (Added 18 of 2015 s. 5)
Monetary Authority (金融管理專員) means the Monetary Authority appointed under section 5A of the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66);

netting (淨額計算), in relation to a clearing and settlement system, means the conversion of the various obligations owed to or by a participant, as between that participant and all the other participants in the system, into one net obligation owed to or by the participant;

obligations (義務), in the context of the default arrangements under a clearing and settlement system, means obligations resulting from the issue and receipt of transfer orders between participants, or otherwise resulting from action taken under the operating rules of the system;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a licensee, means—

subparagraph.content: a chief executive, or manager, of the licensee as defined by section 8A; or
a director of the licensee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a corporation that is a system operator or settlement institution of a designated system, means—

subparagraph.content: a chief executive, director, manager or secretary of the corporation; or
any other person involved in the management of the corporation; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to any other corporation, means—

subparagraph.content: a director, manager or secretary of the corporation; or

section.def: operating rules (運作規則), in relation to a payment system or a stored value facility, means the rules or terms that govern the operation, use or functioning of the system or facility; (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 5)
participant (參與者), in relation to a payment system, means a person who for the time being is a party to the arrangement by which the system is established; (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 5)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a clearing and settlement system; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a retail payment system; (Added 18 of 2015 s. 5)

section.def: prescribed (訂明) means prescribed by regulation made under section 49; (Added 18 of 2015 s. 5)
public (公眾) means the public of Hong Kong, and includes any class of that public; (Added 18 of 2015 s. 5)

def.name: RelevantInsolvencyOfficeholder
def.leadIn: relevant insolvency office-holder (有關破產清盤人員) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Official Receiver appointed under section 75 of the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6);

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: a person acting under the laws of Hong Kong in relation to an individual as his trustee in bankruptcy or interim trustee of his property or an equivalent officer; or (Amended 18 of 2005 s. 48)

paragraph.name: d

section.def: resolution authority (處置機制當局) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Financial Institutions (Resolution) Ordinance (Cap. 628); (Added 23 of 2016 s. 225 and E.R. 2 of 2017)

def.name: ResolutionCompensationTribunal
def.leadIn: Resolution Compensation Tribunal (處置補償審裁處) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Tribunal established by section 127(1) of the Financial Institutions (Resolution) Ordinance (Cap. 628); or (Amended E.R. 2 of 2017)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an additional tribunal established under section 128(1) of that Ordinance; (Added 23 of 2016 s. 225)

section.def: resolution for voluntary winding up (自動清盤決議) means a resolution for voluntary winding up passed under section 228(1)(a) or (b) of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) in respect of which a certificate of solvency has not been issued and delivered in accordance with section 233 of the Ordinance; (Replaced 14 of 2016 s. 187)

def.name: ResolvabilityReviewTribunal
def.leadIn: Resolvability Review Tribunal (處置可行性覆檢審裁處) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Tribunal established by section 110(1) of the Financial Institutions (Resolution) Ordinance (Cap. 628); or (Amended E.R. 2 of 2017)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an additional tribunal established under section 111(1) of that Ordinance; (Added 23 of 2016 s. 225)

def.name: RetailPaymentSystem
def.leadIn: retail payment system (零售支付系統)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: means a system or arrangement for the transfer, clearing or settlement of payment obligations relating to retail activities (whether the activities take place in Hong Kong or elsewhere), principally by individuals, that involve purchases or payments; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: includes related instruments and procedures; (Added 18 of 2015 s. 5)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a payment system—see section 8(1);

paragraph.name: b

section.def: settlement account (交收帳戶), in relation to a clearing and settlement system, means an account at a settlement institution used to hold funds or securities (or both) and to settle transfer orders between participants in the system;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a clearing and settlement system, means a person providing settlement accounts to the participants and to any central counterparty in the system—

subparagraph.content: for the settlement of transfer orders within the system; and
if applicable, for extending credit to the participants and the central counterparty for settlement purposes; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a retail payment system, means a person providing services for the settlement of any payment obligation relating to retail activities for the purposes of the operating rules of the system; (Replaced 18 of 2015 s. 5)

section.def: specified form (指明格式) means a form specified under section 54A; (Added 18 of 2015 s. 5)
stored value (儲值) has the meaning given by section 2A(5); (Added 18 of 2015 s. 5)
stored value facility (儲值支付工具)—see section 2A; (Added 18 of 2015 s. 5)

SVF deposit (工具按金), in relation to a stored value facility issued, or the issue of which is facilitated, under a licence, means a deposit placed with the licensee, or another person on behalf of the licensee, for enabling the facility to be used; (Added 18 of 2015 s. 5)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a clearing and settlement system, means a person who, for the purposes of the operating rules of the system, is responsible for the operation of the clearing or settlement functions of the system; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a retail payment system, means a person who, for the purposes of the operating rules of the system, is responsible for the operation of—

subparagraph.content: the transfer, clearing or settlement functions of the system; or
any other related functions; (Replaced 18 of 2015 s. 5)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a clearing and settlement system, means—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a retail payment system, means an instruction that results in the assumption or discharge of a payment obligation relating to retail activities for the purposes of the operating rules of the system; (Replaced 18 of 2015 s. 5)

section.def: Tribunal (審裁處) means the Tribunal established under section 34(1); (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 5)
user (使用者), in relation to a stored value facility, means a person who uses the facility for the purposes mentioned in section 2A(1)(a) or (b). (Added 18 of 2015 s. 5)

section.name: s2A
section.heading: Interpretation: stored value facility

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, a facility is a stored value facility if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the facility may be used for storing the value of an amount of money that—

subparagraph.content: is paid into the facility from time to time; and
may be stored on the facility under the rules of the facility; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the facility may be used for either or both of the following purposes—

subparagraph.content: as a means of making payments to another person (other than payments mentioned in subparagraph (i)) under an undertaking (whether express or implied) given by the issuer as specified in subsection (3).

subsection.content: The undertaking for subsection (1)(b)(i) is an undertaking that, if the facility is used as a means of making payments for goods or services, the issuer, or a person procured by the issuer to accept such payments, will accept the payments up to the amount of the stored value that is available for use under the rules of the facility.

The undertaking for subsection (1)(b)(ii) is an undertaking that, if the facility is used as a means of making payments to another person (recipient) (other than payments mentioned in subsection (1)(b)(i)), the issuer, or a person procured by the issuer to make such payments, will make the payments to the recipient up to the amount of the stored value that is available for use under the rules of the facility.
A facility is not a stored value facility for the purposes of this Ordinance if it is a single-purpose stored value facility.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: issuer (發行人), in relation to a facility, means the person who issues the facility;

single-purpose stored value facility (單用途儲值支付工具) means a facility—(a)that may be used for the purpose mentioned in subsection (1)(a); and(b)in respect of which the issuer—(i)gives an undertaking that, if the facility is used as a means of making payments for goods or services (not being money or money’s worth) provided by the issuer, the issuer will provide the goods or services under the rules of the facility; and(ii)does not give any other undertaking that falls within the description of subsection (2) or (3);
stored value (儲值), in relation to a facility, means the value stored on the facility as mentioned in subsection (1)(a).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a facility may be in physical or electronic form, but does not include cash;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a reference to money is a reference to—

subparagraph.content: money in any currency; or
any declared medium of exchange; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: except in subsection (5), a reference to goods or services includes money or money’s worth.

section.name: s2B
section.heading: Interpretation: facilitator

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, a person facilitates the issue of a stored value facility if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is not the issuer of the facility; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provides the issuer with valuable consideration the value of which determines, in whole or in part, the extent to which the issuer may give an undertaking that falls within the description of section 2A(2) or (3) in respect of the facility.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(b), the person may provide valuable consideration—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: directly or indirectly; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by electronic means or otherwise.

section.name: s2C
section.heading: Monetary Authority may declare medium of exchange
section.content: The Monetary Authority may, by notice published in the Gazette, declare a thing to be a medium of exchange for the purposes of this Ordinance.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application in relation to designated systems, etc. outside Hong Kong
section.leadIn: This Ordinance applies to and in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a designated system that is established in a place outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a system operator or settlement institution of, or a participant in, a designated system who, being an individual, is outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a system operator or settlement institution of, or a participant in, a designated system that, being a corporation, is incorporated in a place outside Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an officer of a corporation that is a system operator or settlement institution of, or a participant in, a designated system who is outside Hong Kong,

section.continued: as it applies to and in relation to such a system that is established in Hong Kong, such an individual who is in Hong Kong, such a corporation that is incorporated in Hong Kong, or such an officer of a corporation who is in Hong Kong.

part.name: P2
part.heading: Designation and Oversight of Payment Systems

section.name: s4
section.heading: Monetary Authority may designate payment systems

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may, by notice published in the Gazette, designate for the purposes of this Ordinance a clearing and settlement system or retail payment system described in subsection (2) as a designated clearing and settlement system or designated retail payment system (as the case may be) if— (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 10)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the Monetary Authority is of the opinion that the system is, or is likely to become, a clearing and settlement system or retail payment system (as the case may be) whose proper functioning is—

subparagraph.content: material to the monetary or financial stability of Hong Kong; or
material to the functioning of Hong Kong as an international financial centre; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: having regard to matters of significant public interest, the Monetary Authority is of the opinion that the system should be so designated. (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 10)

subsection.leadIn: A clearing and settlement system or retail payment system is a system referred to in subsection (1) if— (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 10)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is in operation in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: it meets either of the following descriptions—

subparagraph.content: for a clearing and settlement system, it accepts for clearing or settlement transfer orders denominated in Hong Kong dollars;
for a retail payment system, it accepts for transfer, clearing or settlement transfer orders denominated in any currency or declared medium of exchange, (Replaced 18 of 2015 s. 10)

subsection.continued: and if it is not a system that is, or is operated by, a company recognized as a clearing house under section 37(1) of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(a), a system is regarded as a system whose proper functioning is material to the monetary or financial stability of Hong Kong, or to the functioning of Hong Kong as an international financial centre, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the occurrence of any significant disruption to, or the presence of any significant inefficiency in, the functioning of the system is likely to adversely affect—

subparagraph.content: the monetary or financial stability of Hong Kong; or
the functioning of Hong Kong as an international financial centre; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the occurrence of any significant disruption to the functioning of the system is likely to cause—

subparagraph.content: systemic disruption to the financial system of Hong Kong. (Replaced 18 of 2015 s. 10)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(b), the following matters are regarded as matters of significant public interest—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: whether the occurrence of any significant disruption to, or the presence of any significant inefficiency in, the functioning of the system is likely to adversely affect the public’s confidence in the financial system of Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whether the occurrence of any significant disruption to, or the presence of any significant inefficiency in, the functioning of the system is likely to adversely affect day-to-day commercial activities. (Added 18 of 2015 s. 10)

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), (3) or (3A), the Monetary Authority may have regard to one or more of the factors specified in subsection (4A), as the factors then apply or appear to be likely to apply, for determining—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: whether a system is, or is likely to become, a system whose proper functioning is—

subparagraph.content: material to the monetary or financial stability of Hong Kong; or
material to the functioning of Hong Kong as an international financial centre; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether a matter is of significant public interest. (Replaced 18 of 2015 s. 10)

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.leadIn: The factors are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the estimated aggregate value of transfer orders transferred, cleared or settled through the system in a normal business day;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the estimated average value of transfer orders transferred, cleared or settled through the system in a normal business day;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the estimated number of transfer orders transferred, cleared or settled through the system in a normal business day;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the estimated number of participants of the system;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: whether the system is linked to any designated system or any clearing and settlement system that is, or is operated by, a company recognized as a clearing house under section 37(1) of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571). (Added 18 of 2015 s. 10)

subsection.name: 4B
subsection.leadIn: In designating a retail payment system under subsection (1), the Monetary Authority may, in the notice published in the Gazette under that subsection, declare the activities that are allowed to be carried out through the system, having regard to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the activities that are carried out through the system before the designation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the operating rules of the system. (Added 18 of 2015 s. 10)

subsection.leadIn: If the Monetary Authority intends to designate a system under subsection (1), or make a declaration under subsection (4B), the Monetary Authority must—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: specify in the notice a period of not less than 14 days within which any system operator or settlement institution of the system may make oral or written representations to the Monetary Authority as to why the designation or declaration should not be made. (Replaced 18 of 2015 s. 10)

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority must, before making the designation or declaration, take into consideration any representation made in the manner mentioned in subsection (5)(b). (Added 18 of 2015 s. 10)

section.name: s5
section.heading: Revocation of designation

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may at any time, by notice published in the Gazette, revoke the designation of a designated system if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority is satisfied that the system is not a system as is described in section 4(2); or (Replaced 18 of 2015 s. 11)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the system—

subparagraph.content: was designated under section 4(1)(a) and, in the opinion of the Monetary Authority, has ceased to be, or to be likely to become, a system mentioned in that section; or
was designated under section 4(1)(b) and, in the opinion of the Monetary Authority, the matters based on which the system was designated have ceased to exist. (Replaced 18 of 2015 s. 11)

subsection.leadIn: If the Monetary Authority intends to revoke the designation of a designated system, the Monetary Authority must—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: specify in the notice a period of not less than 14 days within which any system operator or settlement institution of the system may make oral or written representations to the Monetary Authority as to why the grounds for revocation stated in the notice have not been made out. (Replaced 18 of 2015 s. 11)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: The Monetary Authority must, before revoking the designation, take into consideration any representation made in the manner mentioned in subsection (2)(b). (Added 18 of 2015 s. 11)

A revocation of the designation of a designated system effected under this section shall not operate so as to affect any settlement of a transfer order effected through the system prior to the revocation taking effect.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Obligation to inform Monetary Authority of name and address, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Every person who, at the time of designation of a payment system under this Ordinance, is a system operator or settlement institution of the system must, within 6 days of the designation, inform the Monetary Authority in writing of— (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 12)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: his name, his place of business, a postal address and an electronic mail address;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the aspects of the management or operations of the system for which he is responsible; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in addition, where the person is a corporation, the names and particulars of the directors and shareholders of the corporation and the name and particulars of the chief executive (if any) of the corporation.

subsection.content: Where, subsequent to the designation of a payment system, there is any change to the information given or required to be given to the Monetary Authority under subsection (1) in respect of the system, every person to whom the change relates must, within 6 days of the change taking effect, inform the Monetary Authority in writing of the change. (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 12)

subsection.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on conviction on indictment—

subparagraph.content: to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on summary conviction—

subparagraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues. (Added 18 of 2015 s. 12)

subsection.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on conviction on indictment—

subparagraph.content: to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on summary conviction—

subparagraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues. (Added 18 of 2015 s. 12)

section.name: s6A
section.heading: Restriction on activities carried out through designated retail payment systems

subsection.content: If a declaration of activities is made in respect of a designated retail payment system under section 4(4B), then except with the Monetary Authority’s written consent, a system operator or settlement institution of the system must not carry out through the system an activity that is not declared under that section.

subsection.leadIn: A system operator or settlement institution who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on conviction on indictment—

subparagraph.content: to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on summary conviction—

subparagraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s6B
section.heading: Monetary Authority may give consent for designated retail payment system to carry out activities not declared under section 4(4B)

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may, on the written request of a system operator or settlement institution of a designated retail payment system, give a written consent mentioned in section 6A to allow the activities specified in the consent to be carried out through the system by the operator or institution.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: attach to the consent conditions that the Monetary Authority considers appropriate;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: cancel a condition so attached.

subsection.leadIn: If the Monetary Authority intends to attach conditions to the consent, the Monetary Authority must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: give a written notice to the system operator or settlement institution stating—

subparagraph.content: the intention;
the conditions to be attached; and
the grounds for attaching the conditions; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify in the notice a period of not less than 14 days within which the system operator or settlement institution may make oral or written representations to the Monetary Authority as to why the grounds for attaching the conditions have not been made out.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority must, before attaching the conditions, take into consideration any representation made in the manner mentioned in subsection (3)(b).
The Monetary Authority must, as soon as practicable after making a decision under this section, give a written notice of the decision to the system operator or settlement institution.

subsection.leadIn: A written notice given under subsection (5) must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a decision to give the consent, the decision;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a decision to refuse to give the consent, the decision and the grounds for the decision;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: for a decision to attach conditions—

subparagraph.content: the conditions;
the grounds for attaching the conditions; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for a decision to cancel a condition, the decision.

subsection.leadIn: A system operator or settlement institution who contravenes a condition attached under subsection (2) to a consent given to the operator or institution commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on conviction on indictment—

subparagraph.content: to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on summary conviction—

subparagraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Requirements applying to designated systems

subsection.leadIn: Every system operator and settlement institution of a designated system shall ensure that the following requirements are complied with in relation to the system, namely—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: that there are in place operating rules that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: comply with the requirements specified in subsection (2) and with any prescribed requirements relating to the operating rules of a designated system; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: provide for the system to be operated in accordance with this Ordinance as it applies in relation to that system;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: that there are available to the system financial resources appropriate for the proper performance of the system’s particular functions.

subsection.leadIn: The operating rules of a designated system must— (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 14)

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: provide for default arrangements which are appropriate and adequate for the system in all circumstances; and (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 14)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: provide for appropriate and adequate arrangements to deal with the situation where a system operator or settlement institution of the system is likely to become unable to meet its obligations under the system. (Added 18 of 2015 s. 14)

subsection.content: No change shall be made to the operating rules of a designated system without the prior approval in writing of the Monetary Authority.

subsection.leadIn: If a requirement set out in subsection (1)(a), (b), (c) or (d) is contravened as regards a designated system, every system operator and settlement institution of the system commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on conviction on indictment—

subparagraph.content: to a fine of $400,000; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on summary conviction—

subparagraph.content: to a fine at level 6; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues. (Added 18 of 2015 s. 14)

subsection.leadIn: If subsection (3) is contravened as regards a designated system, every system operator and settlement institution of the system commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine of $400,000; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 6. (Added 18 of 2015 s. 14)

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (4) to prove that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the requirement to which the charge relates concerns an aspect of the management or operation of the designated system that is not an aspect for which the person is responsible; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person took all reasonable steps to ensure that the requirement to which the charge relates was complied with. (Added 18 of 2015 s. 14)

section.name: s8
section.heading: Safety and efficiency of payment systems

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, reference to the safety of a payment system includes in particular any matter relating to— (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 15)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the reliability and robustness of operation of the system;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: access control over the system; (Replaced 18 of 2015 s. 15)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the integrity of, and access control over, the information held within the system; (Replaced 18 of 2015 s. 15)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the risk management and control procedures relating to the operation of the system; (Added 18 of 2015 s. 15)

paragraph.name: f
g
paragraph.content: the services provided to the system by the infrastructure associated with the system; and (Added 18 of 2015 s. 15)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the criteria regarding the safety of the system prescribed for the purposes of this section. (Added 18 of 2015 s. 15)

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, reference to the efficiency of a payment system includes in particular any matter relating to— (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 15)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the speed and efficiency with which operations relating to transfer orders within the system are carried out;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the overall cost to a participant of his participation in the system, having regard to the services provided by the system to its participants;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the reasonableness of criteria for admission as a participant in the system; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for a clearing and settlement system, generally, the absence of measures having the effect of unfairly limiting, or exploiting the absence of, competition in relation to the functions performed by the system. (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 15)

part.name: P2A
part.heading: Licensing and Supervision of Stored Value Facilities

section.name: s8A
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 2A

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—
subsection.def: chief executive (行政總裁), in relation to a licensee, means—(a)the person appointed as the chief executive of the licensee under section 8ZZU;(b)the person appointed as an alternate chief executive of the licensee under section 8ZZU; or(c)the person appointed as a chief executive of the licensee under section 8ZO(3)(a);
licence number (牌照編號), in relation to a licence, means the number assigned to the licence under section 8F(5)(a);

manager (經理), in relation to a licensee—(a)means an individual appointed—(i)by the licensee; or(ii)by a person acting for or on behalf of, or by an arrangement with, the licensee,to be principally responsible (either alone or jointly with others) for the conduct of one or more of the licensee’s affairs or business specified in Schedule 6; but(b)does not include—(i)a person declared, under subsection (2), not to be a manager;(ii)a person belonging to a class of persons declared, under subsection (2), not to be managers; or(iii)a chief executive or director of the licensee;
subsidiary (附屬公司) has the meaning given by section 15 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of the definition of manager in subsection (1), the Monetary Authority may, by notice published in the Gazette and subject to any conditions specified in the notice, declare—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person not to be a manager; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a class of persons not to be managers.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Restriction Relating to Issue of Stored Value Facilities, etc.

section.name: s8B
section.heading: Restriction relating to issue, etc. of stored value facilities

subsection.content: A person must not issue a stored value facility unless the issue of the facility is authorized by a licence held by the person.
A person must not facilitate the issue of a stored value facility unless the facilitation of the issue of the facility is authorized by a licence held by the person.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 5 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s8C
section.heading: Prohibition on promoting issue, etc. of stored value facilities in contravention of section 8B

subsection.content: A person must not knowingly promote or otherwise assist another person in issuing a stored value facility in contravention of section 8B(1).
A person must not knowingly promote or otherwise assist another person in facilitating the issue of a stored value facility in contravention of section 8B(2).
In this section, a reference to promoting or otherwise assisting includes promoting or otherwise assisting by means of providing network or internet portal access or any other technological means.

subsection.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 5 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s8D
section.heading: Prohibition on entering into contracts, etc. for avoiding section 8B or 8C

subsection.content: A person must not enter into a contract or an arrangement, or use any device or scheme, that has the effect of, or is designed to have the effect of, avoiding section 8B(1) or (2) or 8C(1) or (2).

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 5 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s8E
section.heading: Application for licence

subsection.content: A person may apply to the Monetary Authority for a licence.
The application may only be made by a company.

subsection.leadIn: The application must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contain the address of the applicant’s principal place of business in Hong Kong, a postal address and an electronic mail address.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing to the applicant, require the applicant to provide any information or document specified in the notice that the Monetary Authority considers necessary for determining the application.

subsection.leadIn: If the information or document is not provided, the Monetary Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: refuse to process the application further; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: reject the application.

section.name: s8F
section.heading: Determination of application

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may determine an application for a licence made by a person (the applicant) under section 8E by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: granting the licence to the applicant to authorize—

subparagraph.content: the issue of any stored value facility; or
the facilitation of the issue of any stored value facility; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refusing to grant the licence.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may grant the licence without conditions or subject to any conditions attached under section 8I.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may grant the licence to the applicant only if the Monetary Authority is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all the minimum criteria applicable in relation to the applicant are fulfilled; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the licence is granted, the minimum criteria will continue to be fulfilled in relation to the applicant as a licensee.

subsection.leadIn: If the Monetary Authority refuses to grant the licence, the Monetary Authority must give a written notice to the applicant stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the grounds for the decision.

subsection.leadIn: If the Monetary Authority grants a licence, the Monetary Authority must—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: specify in the licence the date on which the licence is to take effect.

section.name: s8G
section.heading: Bank regarded as licensee
section.leadIn: A bank is regarded as being granted a licence under section 8F—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the time when it is granted a banking licence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a bank holding a banking licence on the commencement date* of this section, on that date.

section.name: s8H
section.heading: Validity of licence
section.content: A licence granted under section 8F or regarded as granted under section 8G remains in force until it is revoked under Subdivision 1 of Division 5.

section.name: s8I
section.heading: Monetary Authority may attach conditions to licence

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: attach to a licence conditions that the Monetary Authority considers appropriate, whether the licence is granted under section 8F or regarded as granted under section 8G; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: attach to the licence any new conditions that the Monetary Authority considers appropriate, including by amending the conditions already attached.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), conditions attached under that subsection may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: impose restrictions, either generally or in a particular case, on the business of issuing, or facilitating the issue of, stored value facilities that may be carried on by the licensee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: impose requirements for the administration, maintenance, management, use and regulation of—

subparagraph.content: the float of any stored value facility issued, or the issue of which is facilitated, under the licence, including requirements relating to measures for protecting the float; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: require the licensee to cease to, on and after the date or occurrence of the event specified by the Monetary Authority—

subparagraph.content: issue any stored value facility;
facilitate the issue of any stored value facility;

receive, as the issuer of any stored value facility issued under the licence, any amount of money in any currency, or of any declared medium of exchange, for storage as stored value on the facility; or

receive, as the facilitator of any stored value facility the issue of which is facilitated under the licence, any amount of money in any currency, or of any declared medium of exchange, for facilitating the issue of the facility;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: impose requirements as to the accounts of the licensee, including a requirement to disclose to the Monetary Authority or the public—

subparagraph.content: all or part of those accounts; or
any information relating to the business of the licensee; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: impose restrictions, either generally or in a particular case, as to the maximum amount of stored value that may be stored on a stored value facility issued, or the issue of which is facilitated, under the licence.

subsection.leadIn: A licensee who contravenes a condition attached to its licence under subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on conviction on indictment—

subparagraph.content: to a fine of $400,000; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on summary conviction—

subparagraph.content: to a fine at level 6; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s8J
section.heading: Procedural requirement for attaching conditions to new licence

subsection.content: This section applies to the attachment of conditions under section 8I(1) on the grant of a licence under section 8F.

subsection.leadIn: If the Monetary Authority intends to attach conditions to the licence, the Monetary Authority must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: give a written notice to the person applying for the licence under section 8E (applicant) stating—

subparagraph.content: the intention;
the conditions to be attached; and
the grounds for attaching the conditions; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify in the notice a period of not less than 14 days within which the applicant may make oral or written representations to the Monetary Authority as to why the grounds for attaching the conditions have not been made out.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority must, before attaching the conditions, take into consideration any representation made in the manner mentioned in subsection (2)(b).

subsection.leadIn: If the Monetary Authority decides to attach conditions to the licence, the Monetary Authority must, when the licence is granted, give a written notice to the applicant stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the conditions;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the grounds for attaching the conditions; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the date on which the conditions are to take effect or, if they are to take effect on the occurrence of an event, this fact and the event.

section.name: s8K
section.heading: Procedural requirement for attaching conditions to existing licence

subsection.content: This section applies to the attachment of conditions to a licence under section 8I(1) other than on the grant of a licence under section 8F.

subsection.leadIn: If the Monetary Authority intends to attach conditions to the licence, the Monetary Authority must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: give a written notice to the licensee stating—

subparagraph.content: the intention;
the conditions to be attached; and
the grounds for attaching the conditions; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify in the notice a period of not less than 14 days within which the licensee may make oral or written representations to the Monetary Authority as to why the grounds for attaching the conditions have not been made out.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority must, before attaching the conditions, take into consideration any representation made in the manner mentioned in subsection (2)(b).

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) does not apply in respect of a condition if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the condition falls within the description of section 8I(2)(c); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority considers that it is necessary in the interests of the user or potential user of the stored value facility concerned to make the licence subject to the condition immediately.

subsection.leadIn: If the Monetary Authority decides to attach conditions to the licence, the Monetary Authority must give a written notice to the licensee stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the conditions;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the grounds for attaching the conditions; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the date on which the conditions are to take effect or, if they are to take effect on the occurrence of an event, this fact and the event.

section.name: s8L
section.heading: Cancellation of conditions attached to licence
section.content: The Monetary Authority may at any time cancel a condition attached to a licence under section 8I by giving written notice of the cancellation to the licensee.

section.name: s8M
section.heading: Licence fee payable by licensee that is not bank

subsection.content: This section does not apply to a licensee that is a bank.

subsection.leadIn: A licensee must pay to the Monetary Authority the appropriate licence fee specified in column 3 of Schedule 4—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within 14 days after the date specified under section 8F(5)(b) as the date on which its licence is to take effect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: annually on or before each anniversary of that date.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority must pay the licence fee into the Exchange Fund established under section 3 of the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66).

section.name: s8N
section.heading: Licence fee payable by licensee that is bank

subsection.leadIn: A bank regarded as being granted a licence because of section 8G must pay to the Monetary Authority the appropriate licence fee specified in column 3 of Schedule 4—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: within 14 days after whichever is the earlier of the following dates—

subparagraph.content: the date on which the bank starts to issue a stored value facility under the licence;
the date on which the bank starts to facilitate the issue of a stored value facility under the licence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: annually on or before each anniversary of that date.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(a)(i), the date on which a bank starts to issue a stored value facility is the date on which the facility is available for issue.
The Monetary Authority must pay the licence fee into the Exchange Fund established under section 3 of the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66).

section.name: s8O
section.heading: Obligation to ensure safety and efficiency of stored value facilities

subsection.content: A licensee must ensure that the operation of any stored value facility issued, or the issue of which is facilitated, under its licence is conducted in a safe and efficient manner calculated to minimize the likelihood of any disruption to the functioning of the facility.

subsection.leadIn: A licensee who fails to comply with subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on conviction on indictment—

subparagraph.content: to a fine of $400,000; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on summary conviction—

subparagraph.content: to a fine at level 6; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s8P
section.heading: Further provisions on safety and efficiency of stored value facilities

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, a reference to the safety of a stored value facility includes in particular any matter relating to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the reliability and robustness of the operation of the facility;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: access control over the facility;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the integrity of, and access control over, the information held within the facility;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the risk management and control procedures relating to the operation of the facility;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the soundness of the facility, including financial soundness;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the integrity of the facility;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the services provided to the facility by any infrastructure associated with the facility; and

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the criteria regarding the safety of the facility prescribed for the purposes of this section.

subsection.content: In this Ordinance, a reference to the efficiency of a stored value facility includes in particular any matter relating to the speed and efficiency with which operations relating to the facility are carried out.

section.name: s8Q
section.heading: Obligation to ensure fulfilment of minimum criteria
section.content: A licensee must ensure that all the minimum criteria applicable in relation to the licensee are fulfilled.

section.name: s8R
section.heading: Obligation to report inability to meet obligations

subsection.content: This section does not apply to a licensee that is a bank.

subsection.leadIn: If a licensee is likely to become unable to meet its obligations, or if it is about to suspend payment, it must immediately—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: report the matter to the Monetary Authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide the Monetary Authority with all relevant facts, circumstances and information.

subsection.leadIn: A licensee who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on conviction on indictment—

subparagraph.content: to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on summary conviction—

subparagraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s8S
section.heading: Obligation to notify Monetary Authority of change of particulars

subsection.content: This section does not apply to a licensee that is a bank.

If, after a licence has been granted under section 8F, there is a change to any particulars given by the licensee under section 8E(3)(b), the licensee must notify the Monetary Authority in writing of the change within 6 days after the date on which the change takes place.

subsection.leadIn: A licensee who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on conviction on indictment—

subparagraph.content: to a fine of $400,000; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on summary conviction—

subparagraph.content: to a fine at level 6; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s8T
section.heading: Obligation to notify Monetary Authority of change in circumstances

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if it appears to a licensee that there is, or is likely to be, a material change in the circumstances that is relevant to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the licensee’s ongoing fulfilment of any of the minimum criteria applicable in relation to the licensee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the licensee’s ongoing compliance with any of the conditions attached to its licence under section 8I;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the licensee’s ongoing compliance with section 8O; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the ongoing issue, or facilitation of the issue of, stored value facilities by the licensee.

subsection.leadIn: The licensee must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a material change that has taken place, provide the Monetary Authority with details of the change without undue delay; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a material change that is likely to take place, provide the Monetary Authority with details of the likely change within a reasonable period before the change is reasonably expected to take place.

subsection.content: Information required to be provided under this section must be provided in a form, or verified in a manner, required by the Monetary Authority.

subsection.leadIn: A licensee who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on conviction on indictment—

subparagraph.content: to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $25,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on summary conviction—

subparagraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s8U
section.heading: Revocation of licence regarded as granted under section 8G
section.content: A licence regarded as granted to a bank under section 8G is revoked on the revocation of the banking licence held by the bank under section 22 of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155).

section.name: s8V
section.heading: Revocation of licence on grounds specified in Schedule 5

subsection.leadIn: If the Monetary Authority is satisfied that a ground for revoking a licence specified in Part 2 or 3 of Schedule 5 exists, the Monetary Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: give a written notice to the licensee stating—

subparagraph.content: the Monetary Authority’s intention to propose to revoke the licence; and
the ground for doing so; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify in the notice a period of not less than 14 days within which the licensee may make oral or written representations to the Monetary Authority as to why the ground for the revocation stated in the notice has not been made out.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority must, before proposing to revoke the licence, take into consideration any representation made in the manner mentioned in subsection (1)(b).

subsection.leadIn: If the Monetary Authority proposes to revoke the licence, the Monetary Authority must give a written notice (notice of proposal to revoke) to the licensee stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the Monetary Authority proposes to revoke the licence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the ground for the revocation.

subsection.leadIn: After giving a notice of proposal to revoke, the Monetary Authority must give a notice (notice of revocation) to the licensee as soon as practicable after—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the date on which the period within which, under section 35(2)(b), the licensee may refer the decision to the Tribunal for review has expired without such a reference having been made; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the licensee referred the decision to the Tribunal for review under section 35(1), the Monetary Authority is aware that—

subparagraph.content: the review was unsuccessful; or
the reference was abandoned or withdrawn.

subsection.content: The notice of revocation must state that the licence is or is to be revoked on the date, or the occurrence of the event, specified in the notice.
The licence is revoked on the date, or the occurrence of the event, mentioned in subsection (5).

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority must, as soon as practicable after giving a notice of revocation, publish a notice in Chinese in 1 Chinese language newspaper circulating in Hong Kong, and a notice in English in 1 English language newspaper circulating in Hong Kong, each stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the licensee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the fact that the licence has been revoked; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that the revocation is to take effect on the date, or the occurrence of the event, specified in the notice.

section.name: s8W
section.heading: Effect of revocation of licence

subsection.leadIn: On the revocation of a licence under section 8U or 8V, the person who held the licence immediately before the revocation (former licensee) must not, and must cease to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: issue or facilitate the issue of any stored value facility;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: receive as the facilitator of any stored value facility any amount of money in any currency, or of any declared medium of exchange, for facilitating the issue of the facility; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: unless with the written consent given under section 8X, hold the float and SVF deposit of any stored value facility issued, or the issue of which is facilitated, under the licence.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not prejudice the enforcement or other maintenance of any right or interest—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by any other person against the former licensee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by the former licensee against any other person.

subsection.leadIn: A former licensee who contravenes subsection (1)(d) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s8X
section.heading: Monetary Authority may give consent to hold float and SVF deposit after revocation of licence

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may give a written consent mentioned in section 8W(1)(d) to allow a person to hold the whole or part of the float or SVF deposit of a stored value facility.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: attach to the consent conditions that the Monetary Authority considers appropriate;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: cancel a condition so attached.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (2), conditions attached under that subsection may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specify the period for which the float or SVF deposit may be held by the person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the manner in which the float or deposit may be held by the person.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing to the person, require the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to provide any information or document specified in the notice that the Monetary Authority considers necessary for ascertaining whether the person complies, or will comply, with a condition attached under subsection (2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to provide the information or document within the period, and in the manner, specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: This section does not prejudice the enforcement or other maintenance of any right or interest—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by any other person against the person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by the person against any other person.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes a condition attached under subsection (2) to a consent given to the person commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on conviction on indictment—

subparagraph.content: to a fine of $400,000; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on summary conviction—

subparagraph.content: to a fine at level 6; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a requirement under subsection (4) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on conviction on indictment—

subparagraph.content: to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $25,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on summary conviction—

subparagraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s8Y
section.heading: Suspension of licence regarded as granted under section 8G
section.content: A licence regarded as granted to a bank under section 8G is suspended while the banking licence held by the bank is suspended under section 24 or 25 of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155).

section.name: s8Z
section.heading: Temporary suspension of licence

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing to a licensee, suspend its licence for a period not exceeding 14 days if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority is satisfied that a ground for revoking a licence specified in Part 2 of Schedule 5 exists; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority considers that it is necessary in the interests of the user or potential user of any stored value facility issued, or the issue of which is facilitated, under the licence that urgent actions be taken.

subsection.leadIn: The notice must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the licence is or is to be suspended under this section on the date specified in the notice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the ground for the suspension.

subsection.content: The licence is suspended under this section on the date mentioned in subsection (2)(a).

subsection.leadIn: The notice may be accompanied by another notice (accompanying notice) stating that the Monetary Authority is considering whether—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to propose the revocation of the licence under section 8V; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to suspend the licence under section 8ZA.

subsection.leadIn: The accompanying notice must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for subsection (4)(a), inform the licensee of the requirement of section 8V(1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for subsection (4)(b), inform the licensee of the requirement of section 8ZA(2).

subsection.leadIn: A suspension under this section ceases to have effect on the earlier of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the expiry of a period of 14 days beginning on the date mentioned in subsection (2)(a);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date, or the occurrence of the event, as may be specified in a written notice given by the Monetary Authority to the licensee for the purposes of this paragraph.

section.name: s8ZA
section.heading: Suspension of licence

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing (suspension notice) to a licensee, suspend its licence for a period not exceeding 6 months if the Monetary Authority is satisfied that a ground for revoking a licence specified in Part 2 of Schedule 5 exists.

subsection.leadIn: If the Monetary Authority intends to suspend a licence under subsection (1), the Monetary Authority must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: give a written notice to the licensee stating—

subparagraph.content: the intention; and
the ground for doing so; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify in the notice a period of not less than 14 days within which the licensee may make oral or written representations to the Monetary Authority as to why the ground for the suspension stated in the notice has not been made out.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority must, before suspending the licence, take into consideration any representation made in the manner mentioned in subsection (2)(b).

subsection.leadIn: The suspension notice must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the licence is or is to be suspended under this section on the date specified in the notice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the ground for the suspension.

subsection.content: The licence is suspended under this section on the date mentioned in subsection (4)(a).

subsection.leadIn: A suspension under this section ceases to have effect on the earlier of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the expiry of 6 months beginning on the date mentioned in subsection (4)(a);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date, or the occurrence of the event, as may be specified in a written notice given by the Monetary Authority to the licensee for the purposes of this paragraph.

subsection.content: Before a suspension under this section ceases to have effect, the Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing to the licensee, renew the suspension for a period not exceeding 6 months beginning immediately after the suspension ceases to have effect.

section.name: s8ZB
section.heading: Effect of suspension under section 8Y, 8Z or 8ZA

subsection.leadIn: During the period when a licence is suspended under section 8Y, 8Z or 8ZA, the licensee must not, and must cease to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: issue or facilitate the issue of any stored value facility;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: receive as the issuer of any stored value facility any amount of money in any currency, or of any declared medium of exchange, for storage as stored value on the facility;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: receive as the facilitator of any stored value facility any amount of money in any currency, or of any declared medium of exchange, for facilitating the issue of the facility; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: unless with the written consent given under section 8ZC, hold the float and SVF deposit of any stored value facility issued, or the issue of which is facilitated, under the licence.

subsection.leadIn: Unless otherwise stated in the notice under section 8Z(1) or 8ZA(1), the licensee must continue to comply with the following provisions as if the licence were not suspended—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 8M or 8N, as may be applicable;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Division 6; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other provisions of this Ordinance under which duties and obligations are imposed on a licensee.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not prejudice the enforcement or other maintenance of any right or interest—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by any other person against the licensee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by the licensee against any other person.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1)(d) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 5 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s8ZC
section.heading: Monetary Authority may give consent to hold float and SVF deposit while licence is suspended

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may give a written consent mentioned in section 8ZB(1)(d) to allow the licensee to hold the whole or part of the float or SVF deposit of a stored value facility.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: attach to the consent conditions that the Monetary Authority considers appropriate;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: cancel a condition so attached.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (2), conditions attached under that subsection may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specify the period for which the float or SVF deposit may be held by the licensee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the manner in which the float or deposit may be held by the licensee.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing to the licensee, require the licensee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to provide any information or document specified in the notice that the Monetary Authority considers necessary for ascertaining whether the licensee complies, or will comply, with a condition attached under subsection (2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to provide the information or document within the period, and in the manner, specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: This section does not prejudice the enforcement or other maintenance of any right or interest—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by any other person against the licensee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by the licensee against any other person.

subsection.leadIn: A licensee who contravenes a condition attached under subsection (2) to a consent given to the licensee commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on conviction on indictment—

subparagraph.content: to a fine of $400,000; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on summary conviction—

subparagraph.content: to a fine at level 6; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: A licensee who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a requirement under subsection (4) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on conviction on indictment—

subparagraph.content: to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $25,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on summary conviction—

subparagraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s8ZD
section.heading: Application of Division 6
section.content: This Division does not apply to a licensee that is a bank.

subdivision.name: SD2
subdivision.heading: Powers of Monetary Authority over Management of Licensee

section.name: s8ZE
section.heading: Circumstances under which powers under this Division may be exercised

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may, after consulting the Financial Secretary, exercise one or more of the powers under sections 8ZF, 8ZG and 8ZH that appear to the Monetary Authority to be necessary in respect of a licensee if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the licensee informs the Monetary Authority—

subparagraph.content: that it is likely to become unable to meet its obligations; or
that it is insolvent or is about to suspend payment;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the licensee is unable to meet its obligations or suspends payment; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the Monetary Authority is of the opinion that—

subparagraph.content: the licensee is carrying on its business in a manner detrimental to the interests of the user or potential user of any stored value facility issued, or the issue of which is facilitated, under its licence;
the licensee is carrying on its business in a manner detrimental to the interests of its creditors;
the licensee is likely to become unable to meet its obligation or, is insolvent or is about to suspend payment;
the licensee has contravened a provision of this Ordinance or a condition attached to its licence under section 8I; or
a ground for revoking a licence specified in Part 2 or 3 of Schedule 5 exists.
