subsection.leadIn: Without limiting any other meaning which insolvent may have, a licensee is regarded to be insolvent if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it has ceased to pay its debt in the ordinary course of business; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it cannot pay its debt when it becomes due.

section.name: s8ZF
section.heading: Power to require licensee to take immediate action relating to its affairs, etc.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing to a licensee, require the licensee to take an immediate action relating to the licensee’s affairs, business or property that the Monetary Authority considers necessary.
Without limiting subsection (1), the requirement may impose restrictions on the licensee’s business of issuing, or facilitating the issue of, stored value facilities under the licence.

subsection.leadIn: A licensee who fails to comply with a requirement under subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on conviction on indictment—

subparagraph.content: to a fine of $2,000,000 and to imprisonment for 5 years; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $100,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on summary conviction—

subparagraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s8ZG
section.heading: Power to give direction for licensee to seek advice on management of its affairs, etc.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by notice in writing to a licensee, direct the licensee to seek advice on the management of the licensee’s affairs, business or property specified in the terms of the direction from an Advisor appointed by the Monetary Authority while the direction is in force; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: appoint a person to be an Advisor for paragraph (a).

subsection.leadIn: The notice must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: state the terms of the direction;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be given to the licensee at its principal place of business in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: state the name and address of the Advisor.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority must specify in the terms of the direction the affairs, business or property to which the direction relates.
The direction takes effect on the giving of the notice to the licensee by the Monetary Authority.
The Monetary Authority must not give a direction to a licensee under this section if an order for the winding up of the licensee made by the Court of First Instance is in force.

section.name: s8ZH
section.heading: Power to give direction for licensee’s affairs, etc. to be managed by Manager

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by notice in writing to a licensee, direct that the licensee’s affairs, business or property specified in the terms of the direction is to be managed by a Manager appointed by the Monetary Authority while the direction is in force; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: appoint a person to be a Manager for paragraph (a).

subsection.leadIn: The notice must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: state the terms of the direction;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be given to the licensee at its principal place of business in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: state the name and address of the Manager.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority must specify in the terms of the direction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the affairs, business or property to which the direction relates; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: one or more primary objectives, that are not inconsistent with this Ordinance, with which the Manager must comply.

subsection.content: The direction takes effect on the giving of the notice to the licensee by the Monetary Authority.
The Monetary Authority must not give a direction to a licensee under this section if an order for the winding up of the licensee made by the Court of First Instance is in force.

section.name: s8ZI
section.heading: Supplementary provisions relating to appointment of Advisor or Manager under section 8ZG or 8ZH

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may, in exercising the power under section 8ZG(1)(b) or 8ZH(1)(b) in respect of a licensee, appoint 2 or more persons to be the Advisor or Manager of the licensee.

subsection.leadIn: The Advisor or Manager may be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a corporation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a partnership; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person appointed under section 5A(3) of the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66) to assist the Monetary Authority.

subsection.leadIn: If 2 or more persons are appointed as the Manager of a licensee under section 8ZH(1)(b), the Monetary Authority must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: by notice in writing (appointment notice), specify which of the duties and powers imposed or conferred under this Ordinance on a Manager may be discharged, or exercised, in respect of the licensee by—

subparagraph.content: any such person alone;
any such persons jointly; or
each such person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: attach the appointment notice to the notice giving the direction under section 8ZH.

subsection.content: If an appointment notice is given under subsection (3), the provisions of this Ordinance that relate to the duties and powers imposed or conferred under this Ordinance on a Manager are to be construed with all necessary modifications to take into account the notice.

subdivision.name: SD3
subdivision.heading: Further Provisions Regarding Direction under Section 8ZH

section.name: s8ZJ
section.heading: Interpretation of Subdivision 3
section.leadIn: In this Subdivision—
section.def: direction (指示) means a direction given under section 8ZH.

section.name: s8ZK
section.heading: Publication of direction

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority must publish a notice given under section 8ZH(1)(a) (direction notice)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the Gazette; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other way that appears to the Monetary Authority to be expedient for notifying the public of the direction.

subsection.content: If the Monetary Authority gives a notice under section 8ZI(3)(a) (appointment notice), the Monetary Authority must publish the appointment notice together with the direction notice to which the appointment notice relates.

section.name: s8ZL
section.heading: References to affairs, business or property of licensee, and objective of Manager

subsection.leadIn: While a direction is in force in respect of a licensee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference in this Ordinance to the affairs, business or property, or any combination of them, of the licensee is to be construed as the affairs, business or property, or any combination of them, of the licensee as specified in the terms of the direction under section 8ZH(3)(a); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference in this Ordinance to the primary objective with which the Manager of the licensee must comply is to be construed as the primary objective as specified in the terms of the direction under section 8ZH(3)(b).

subsection.content: If the terms of the direction are varied under section 8ZT, a reference to the terms in subsection (1) is to be construed as the terms as varied under that section.

section.name: s8ZM
section.heading: Effect of direction: chief executive and director of licensee

subsection.leadIn: On a direction taking effect in respect of a licensee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an appointment of a person as a chief executive or director of the licensee that was in force immediately before the direction takes effect is regarded as revoked; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accordingly the person must not act as such a chief executive or director while the direction is in force.

subsection.content: Subsection (1)(a) does not apply to an appointment if the terms of the direction expressly state that the appointment is not to be regarded as revoked under that subsection.

subsection.leadIn: A person who acts as a chief executive or director of a licensee in contravention of subsection (1)(b) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on conviction on indictment—

subparagraph.content: to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on summary conviction—

subparagraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s8ZN
section.heading: Effect of direction: meeting and resolution

subsection.leadIn: While a direction is in force in respect of a licensee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no general meeting of the members of the licensee nor any meeting of the directors of the licensee may be held, except with the consent and in the presence of the Manager of the licensee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if any such meeting is held with the consent and in the presence of the Manager, no resolution may be passed at the meeting, except with the consent of the Manager.

subsection.leadIn: If a member or director of the licensee requests the Manager of the licensee to give a consent for the purposes of subsection (1)(a), the Manager—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must not unreasonably refuse the request; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if such a consent is given, must attend the meeting held with the consent.

subsection.content: Subject to section 8ZQ, if a resolution is passed in contravention of subsection (1)(b), the purported resolution, and any thing done in reliance on the purported resolution, is invalid because of the contravention.

section.name: s8ZO
section.heading: Power of Manager

subsection.leadIn: Subject to the primary objective with which the Manager of a licensee must comply, the Manager may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: do any thing necessary for the management of the licensee’s affairs, business or property; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without limiting paragraph (a), exercise one or more of the powers specified in Schedule 7.

subsection.leadIn: The Manager—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may call any meeting of the members, directors or creditors of the licensee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: may require any person whose appointment as a chief executive or director of the licensee is regarded as revoked under section 8ZM(1) or is not so revoked because of section 8ZM(2)—

subparagraph.content: to provide the Manager with any information or document relating to the licensee’s affairs, business or property that the Manager requires for discharging or exercising the Manager’s duties or powers under this Ordinance in respect of the licensee; and
to provide the information or document within the period, and in the manner, required by the Manager.

subsection.leadIn: The Manager may exercise one or more of the following powers with the approval of the Monetary Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: appoint any person (including a person whose appointment as a chief executive or director of the licensee is regarded as revoked under section 8ZM(1)) as a chief executive or director of the licensee, whether or not to fill a vacancy that arises as a result of the operation of that section;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: at a meeting of the members of the licensee, move any resolution that is—

subparagraph.content: seconded by a member of the licensee; or
approved by the Monetary Authority;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: at a meeting of the directors of the licensee, move any resolution that is—

subparagraph.content: seconded by a director of the licensee; or
approved by the Monetary Authority;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: revoke an appointment to which section 8ZM(2) relates or made under paragraph (a).

subsection.content: If, while a direction is in force in respect of a licensee, a conferred power may be exercised in such a way as to interfere with the exercise of the powers of the Manager of the licensee, the conferred power is not exercisable except with the consent of the Manager given either generally or in a particular case.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (4), a conferred power is a power conferred on the licensee, or an officer or a member of the licensee, under—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the articles of association of the licensee; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other instrument constituting the licensee.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to the primary objective with which the Manager of a licensee must comply—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Manager exercising the powers conferred on the Manager under this Ordinance is regarded as acting as an agent of the licensee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: section 9 (other than subsections (4) and (5) of that section) of the Prevention of Bribery Ordinance (Cap. 201) applies to—

subparagraph.content: the Manager acting as such an agent; and
a person who offers an advantage (within the meaning of that Ordinance) to the Manager acting as such an agent.

subsection.leadIn: A person dealing with a Manager of a licensee in good faith and for good consideration is not required to inquire whether the Manager—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is acting within the Manager’s powers; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is complying with the primary objective with which the Manager must comply.

subsection.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a requirement under subsection (2)(b) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on conviction on indictment—

subparagraph.content: to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $100,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on summary conviction—

subparagraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s8ZP
section.heading: Manager may delegate duty and power

subsection.content: With the written approval of the Monetary Authority, a Manager may, subject to the terms and conditions that the Manager thinks fit to impose, delegate in writing to a person any or all of the duties and powers imposed or conferred under this Ordinance on the Manager.
Subsection (1) does not apply to any duties or powers that are not to be, or may not be, discharged or exercised by the Manager because of a notice given under section 8ZI(3).

subsection.leadIn: A delegate of a Manager—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must discharge the delegated duties as if the delegate were the Manager;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may exercise the delegated powers as if the delegate were the Manager; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is presumed to be acting in accordance with the terms and conditions of the delegation in the absence of evidence to the contrary.

section.name: s8ZQ
section.heading: Court of First Instance may approve certain resolutions

subsection.leadIn: The Court of First Instance may, while a direction is in force in respect of a licensee, approve or refuse to approve a resolution specified in subsection (2) on the application of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Manager of the licensee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not less than 100 members of the licensee; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the members of the licensee holding not less than one-tenth of the issued shares in the licensee.

subsection.leadIn: The resolution is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the application is made under subsection (1)(a)—

subparagraph.content: a resolution proposed to be moved at a general meeting of the members of the licensee but not so moved because a quorum is not present at the meeting; or
a resolution properly moved at a general meeting of the members of the licensee but not passed for whatever reason; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the application is made under subsection (1)(b) or (c), a resolution properly moved at a general meeting of the members of the licensee but not passed for whatever reason.

subsection.leadIn: In the hearing of the application, the Manager, the Monetary Authority or any member of the licensee is entitled to be heard, and may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: call, examine and cross-examine witnesses; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: support or oppose the application.

subsection.content: If the Court of First Instance approves a resolution under subsection (1), the resolution is regarded as passed and taking effect on that approval or at a later time the Court thinks fit to specify.

If a resolution mentioned in subsection (2)(a)(ii) or (b) is approved by the Court of First Instance under subsection (1), section 8ZN(3) does not apply to the resolution on and after the resolution is regarded as taking effect.

section.name: s8ZR
section.heading: Court of First Instance may make certain orders

subsection.leadIn: The Court of First Instance may, on the application of the Manager of a licensee made while a direction is in force in respect of the licensee, make one or more of the orders specified in subsection (2) if it appears to the Court that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person is about to do an act that may adversely affect or conflict with the discharge or exercise of the Manager’s duties or powers in respect of any of the affairs, business or property of the licensee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person is doing, or has done, an act that adversely affects or conflicts with the discharge or exercise of the Manager’s duties or powers in respect of any of the affairs, business or property of the licensee.

subsection.leadIn: The orders are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for subsection (1)(a), an order to restrain the person from doing the act mentioned in that subsection;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for subsection (1)(b)—

subparagraph.content: an order to declare that, with effect on and after the date of the order, the act mentioned in that subsection is invalid; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an order to direct a person to do or refrain from doing an act, for securing compliance with any other order made under this section;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an ancillary order that the Court of First Instance considers necessary in consequence of the making of any other order under this section.

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, an order mentioned in subsection (2)(b) does not affect the validity of an act, or any thing done in reliance on the act, before the date of the order.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not prejudice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the operation of any other provisions of this Division; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any order that the Court of First Instance may make otherwise than under this section.

subsection.leadIn: Before making an order under subsection (1), the Court of First Instance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may direct that a notice of the application under that subsection be given to those persons the Court thinks fit; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may direct that a notice of the application be published in the manner the Court thinks fit.

subsection.content: The Court of First Instance may, on its own initiative or on an application made to it for that purpose, by order suspend, reverse, vary or discharge an order made under this section.
Before making an order under subsection (1) or (6), the Court of First Instance must satisfy itself, in so far as it can reasonably do so, that the order would not unfairly prejudice any person.

section.name: s8ZS
section.heading: Obstructing Manager in discharging duties, etc.

subsection.content: A person must not wilfully obstruct, resist or delay a Manager of a licensee in the lawful discharge of the Manager’s duties, or the lawful exercise of the Manager’s powers, in respect of the licensee.

A person must not wilfully obstruct, resist or delay a person lawfully assisting the Manager in the lawful discharge of the Manager’s duties, or the lawful exercise of the Manager’s powers, in respect of the licensee.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on conviction on indictment—

subparagraph.content: to a fine of $2,000,000 and to imprisonment for 5 years; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $100,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on summary conviction—

subparagraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 2 years; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s8ZT
section.heading: Variations of directions

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing, from time to time vary a direction in respect of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the affairs, business or property of a licensee that is to be managed by the Manager of the licensee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the primary objective with which the Manager must comply.

subsection.leadIn: The notice must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: state the variation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be given to the licensee at its principal place of business in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be given to the Manager.

subsection.content: Unless otherwise specified in the notice, the variation takes effect when the notice is given to the licensee and the Manager under subsection (2).
An act or thing done in reliance on a direction before a variation is made is not invalid only because of the variation.

subdivision.name: SD4
subdivision.heading: Revocation of Direction under Section 8ZG or 8ZH

section.name: s8ZU
section.heading: Revocation of direction under section 8ZG or 8ZH

subsection.content: If it appears to the Monetary Authority that it is no longer necessary for a direction under section 8ZG or 8ZH to remain in force in respect of a licensee, the Monetary Authority must, after consulting the Financial Secretary, by notice in writing revoke the direction.

subsection.leadIn: The notice must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: state that the direction is revoked;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be given to the licensee at its principal place of business in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: be given to—

subparagraph.content: for a direction under section 8ZG, the Advisor of the licensee; or
for a direction under section 8ZH, the Manager of the licensee.

subsection.leadIn: If the notice is given for revoking a direction under section 8ZH, the Monetary Authority must publish the notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the Gazette; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other way that appears to the Monetary Authority to be expedient for notifying the public of the revocation.

subsection.content: Unless otherwise specified in the notice, a revocation takes effect when the notice is given to the licensee, and the Advisor or Manager, under subsection (2).
To avoid doubt, the revocation of a direction under section 8ZH does not revive any appointment that is regarded as having been revoked under section 8ZM(1).

section.name: s8ZV
section.heading: Revocation of appointment of Advisor or Manager

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may at any time revoke the appointment of an Advisor or a Manager made under section 8ZG(1)(b) or 8ZH(1)(b).

If an Advisor or a Manager is appointed for the purposes of a direction under section 8ZG or 8ZH and the direction is subsequently revoked under section 8ZU, the appointment of the Advisor or Manager is regarded as revoked at the time when the revocation takes effect.

section.name: s8ZW
section.heading: Resignation of Advisor or Manager

subsection.content: An Advisor or a Manager may, at any time by notice in writing to the Monetary Authority, resign from office.
A resignation under subsection (1) takes effect when it is accepted by the Monetary Authority.

section.name: s8ZX
section.heading: Appointment to fill vacancy in office of Advisor or Manager

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if a vacancy arises in the office of an Advisor or a Manager because of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the operation of section 8ZV or 8ZW; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the death of the holder of the office.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority must, as soon as practicable after a vacancy arises—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: appoint a person to fill the vacancy; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give a written notice to the licensee at its principal place of business in Hong Kong specifying the name and address of the person so appointed.

section.name: s8ZY
section.heading: Advisor or Manager may engage technical or professional person

subsection.content: An Advisor or a Manager may engage a technical or professional person as they think fit to assist in the discharge or exercise of their duties or powers, in respect of the affairs, business or property of the licensee.
The person that the Advisor or Manager may engage includes a person appointed under section 5A(3) of the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66) to assist the Monetary Authority.

subsection.leadIn: The power under subsection (1) may only be exercised—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: with the written approval of the Monetary Authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in accordance with the conditions as may be specified by the Monetary Authority in that approval.

section.name: s8ZZ
section.heading: Remuneration and expenses of Advisor or Manager

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may, after consulting the Financial Secretary, at any time determine the remuneration or expenses to be paid by a licensee to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Advisor of the licensee or a person engaged by the Advisor under section 8ZY; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Manager of the licensee or a person engaged by the Manager under section 8ZY.

subsection.leadIn: The power under subsection (1) may be exercised whether or not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the appointment of the Advisor or Manager, or the person engaged under section 8ZY, has been revoked or has otherwise been terminated; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the direction under section 8ZG or 8ZH for the purposes of which the Advisor or Manager was appointed has been revoked.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority must, as soon as practicable after making a determination under subsection (1)(a), give a copy of the determination to the licensee at its principal place of business in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as soon as practicable after making a determination under subsection (1)(b), publish in the Gazette a notice stating the name of the licensee and the fact that the determination has been made; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if requested by a member of the licensee, give a copy of the determination to the member.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may, after consulting the Financial Secretary, use the Exchange Fund established under section 3 of the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66) to pay the whole or part of the remuneration or expenses payable under a determination under subsection (1).

section.name: s8ZZA
section.heading: Interpretation of Division 7
section.leadIn: In this Division—
section.def: associate (相聯者), in relation to a person (relevant person) entitled to exercise, or control the exercise of, the voting rights in relation to, or holding shares in, a corporation, means any other person in respect of whom—(a)the relevant person has an agreement or arrangement (whether oral or in writing, express or implied) with respect to the acquisition, holding or disposal of shares or other interests in that corporation; or(b)the relevant person has an agreement or arrangement (whether oral or in writing, express or implied) under which the relevant person and that other person act together in exercising their voting rights in relation to the corporation;

indirect controller (間接控權人), in relation to a corporation—(a)means a person in accordance with whose directions or instructions (excluding advice given in a professional capacity) the directors or a majority of the directors of the corporation, or any other corporation of which the corporation is a subsidiary, are accustomed to act; but(b)does not include an Advisor or a Manager of the corporation;

majority shareholder controller (大股東控權人), in relation to a corporation, means a person who, either alone or jointly with an associate, is entitled to exercise, or control the exercise of, more than 50% of the voting rights at a general meeting of—(a)the corporation; or(b)any other corporation of which the corporation is a subsidiary;

minority shareholder controller (小股東控權人), in relation to a corporation, means a person who, either alone or jointly with an associate, is entitled to exercise, or control the exercise of, at least 10% but not more than 50% of the voting rights at a general meeting of—(a)the corporation; or(b)any other corporation of which the corporation is a subsidiary.

section.name: s8ZZB
section.heading: Application of Division 7
section.content: This Division does not apply to a licensee that is a bank.

subdivision.name: SD2
subdivision.heading: Sale and Disposal of Business etc. of Licensee

section.name: s8ZZC
section.heading: Sale and disposal of business require approval

subsection.content: Except with the prior written approval of the Monetary Authority, a licensee must not make an arrangement, or enter into an agreement, for the sale or disposal of the whole or part of its business.

subsection.leadIn: A licensee who makes or enters into an arrangement or agreement mentioned in subsection (1) must, as soon as practicable after doing so—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: provide the Monetary Authority with any information on the arrangement or agreement that the Monetary Authority may require.

subsection.content: Subsection (2) applies irrespective of whether the arrangement or agreement is made or entered into with the approval mentioned in subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: A licensee who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A licensee who fails to comply with subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment or on summary conviction, to a fine at level 6; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s8ZZD
section.heading: Reconstruction of capital

subsection.leadIn: A licensee who makes a reconstruction of its capital must, as soon as practicable after doing so—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notify the Monetary Authority of the reconstruction by written notice signed by a director of the licensee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide the Monetary Authority with any information on the reconstruction that the Monetary Authority may require.

subsection.leadIn: A licensee who fails to comply with subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment or on summary conviction, to a fine at level 6; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

subdivision.name: SD3
subdivision.heading: Majority Shareholder Controller, Minority Shareholder Controller and Indirect Controller of Licensee

section.name: s8ZZE
section.heading: Interpretation of Subdivision 3

subsection.leadIn: In this Subdivision—
subsection.def: consent notice (同意通知) means a consent notice given under section 8ZZF(2)(a) or 8ZZG(3)(a);
controller (控權人) means—(a)a majority shareholder controller;(b)a minority shareholder controller; or(c)an indirect controller;
objection notice (反對通知) means an objection notice given under section 8ZZF(2)(b), 8ZZG(3)(b) or 8ZZJ(2).

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), a reference in this Subdivision to a specified notice period for the giving of a consent notice or an objection notice to a person is the aggregate of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a period of 3 months; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person is required under section 8ZZF(3) or 8ZZG(4) to provide any information, the period beginning on the date on which the requirement is made and ending on the date on which the Monetary Authority receives the information.

subsection.content: If the person is given a preliminary notice under section 8ZZH(3) or 8ZZI(3), the specified notice period does not expire, if it would otherwise do so, until 14 days after the expiry of the period within which the person may make representations under that section.

section.name: s8ZZF
section.heading: Becoming controller of licensee

subsection.content: A person who is to become a controller of a licensee must give a written notice to the Monetary Authority stating that the person proposes to become such a controller.

subsection.leadIn: After receiving from a person a notice under subsection (1), the Monetary Authority may, within the specified notice period beginning from the receipt of the notice (notice period)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: consent to the person becoming such a controller by giving the person a consent notice, whether or not subject to conditions attached under section 8ZZH; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: object to the person becoming such a controller by giving the person an objection notice.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may require the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to provide the Monetary Authority with any information that the Monetary Authority requires for deciding whether to consent, or object, to the person becoming such a controller; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to provide the information within the period, and in the manner, required by the Monetary Authority.

subsection.leadIn: The person may become such a controller only in the circumstances described below—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if a consent notice is given to the person within the notice period, the person becomes such a controller within 12 months from the receipt of the consent notice;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if an objection notice is given to the person within the notice period—

subparagraph.content: the person becomes such a controller within 12 months from the date on which the Tribunal’s determination on the decision is made; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if neither a consent notice nor an objection notice is given within the notice period, the person becomes such a controller within 12 months from the expiry of the notice period.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (4) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 5 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.content: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (5) to prove that the person did not know that the acts or circumstances because of which the person became such a controller were such as to have that effect.

section.name: s8ZZG
section.heading: Person who has become controller in circumstances other than those described in section 8ZZF(4)

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: becomes a controller in circumstances other than those described in section 8ZZF(4);

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: subsequently becomes aware of the fact that the person has become such a controller.

subsection.content: The person must, within 14 days after the date on which the person becomes aware of that fact, give a written notice to the Monetary Authority stating that the person has become such a controller.

subsection.leadIn: After receiving from a person a notice under subsection (2), the Monetary Authority may, within the specified notice period beginning from the day on which the Monetary Authority becomes aware of the fact that the person has become such a controller—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: consent to the person being such a controller by giving the person a consent notice, whether or not subject to conditions attached under section 8ZZH; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: object to the person being such a controller by giving the person an objection notice.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may require the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to provide the Monetary Authority with any information that the Monetary Authority requires for deciding whether to consent, or object, to the person being such a controller; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to provide the information within the period, and in the manner, required by the Monetary Authority.

subsection.leadIn: A person who fails to comply with subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on conviction on indictment—

subparagraph.content: to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on summary conviction—

subparagraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s8ZZH
section.heading: Supplementary provisions relating to consent notice

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: attach to a consent notice conditions that the Monetary Authority considers appropriate;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: cancel a condition so attached.

subsection.content: Without limiting subsection (1), the Monetary Authority may attach to a consent notice conditions that the Monetary Authority considers appropriate to safeguard the interests of the user or potential user of any stored value facility issued, or the issue of which is facilitated, under the licence of the licensee.

subsection.leadIn: If the Monetary Authority intends to attach conditions to a consent notice, the Monetary Authority must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: give a written notice (preliminary notice) to the person to whom the consent notice is or is to be given stating—

subparagraph.content: the intention;
the conditions to be attached; and
the grounds for attaching the conditions; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: state in the preliminary notice that the person may, within 1 month from the receipt of the preliminary notice, make oral or written representations to the Monetary Authority as to why the grounds for attaching the conditions have not been made out.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority must, before attaching the conditions, take into consideration any representation made in the manner mentioned in subsection (3)(b).

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may attach a condition to a consent notice to a person only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the condition is stated in a preliminary notice to the person under subsection (3); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person consents to the condition to be so attached.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority must, as soon as practicable after making a decision under this section, give a written notice of the decision to the person.

subsection.leadIn: A written notice given under subsection (6) must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for a decision to attach conditions—

subparagraph.content: the conditions;
the grounds for attaching the conditions; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a decision to cancel a condition, the decision.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes a condition attached under this section to a consent notice given to the person commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on conviction on indictment—

subparagraph.content: to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 3 years; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on summary conviction—

subparagraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s8ZZI
section.heading: Supplementary provisions relating to objection notice under section 8ZZF(2)(b) or 8ZZG(3)(b)

subsection.content: This section applies to an objection notice to be given to a person under section 8ZZF(2)(b) or 8ZZG(3)(b).

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may give an objection notice to the person only if the Monetary Authority considers that any of the following conditions (specified conditions) is not satisfied—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the person is a fit and proper person to become or to be a controller of the licensee concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the interests of the user or potential user of any stored value facility issued, or the issue of which is facilitated, under the licence of the licensee would not be, or are not, in any manner threatened by the person becoming or being such a controller;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the person is not presently such a controller, having regard to the person’s likely influence on the licensee if the person were to become such a controller—

subparagraph.content: (if the Monetary Authority is of the opinion that the licensee is currently carrying on its business prudently) that the licensee is likely to continue so carrying on its business; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: if the person is presently such a controller, having regard to the person’s influence on the licensee as such a controller—

subparagraph.content: (if the Monetary Authority is of the opinion that the licensee was carrying on its business prudently before the person became such a controller) that the licensee is, and is likely to continue, so carrying on its business; or
(if the Monetary Authority is of any other opinion) that the person is taking, or is likely to take, adequate remedial action to ensure that the licensee will carry on its business prudently.

subsection.leadIn: If the Monetary Authority intends to give an objection notice to a person, the Monetary Authority must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: give a written notice (preliminary notice) to the person stating—

subparagraph.content: the intention; and
the specified condition that the Monetary Authority considers is not satisfied; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: state in the preliminary notice that the person may, within 1 month from the receipt of the preliminary notice, make oral or written representations to the Monetary Authority as to why an objection notice should not be given.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority must, before giving an objection notice, take into consideration any representation made in the manner mentioned in subsection (3)(b).
On giving an objection notice, the Monetary Authority must state in the notice the specified condition that the Monetary Authority considers is not satisfied.
For the purposes of subsection (5), the Monetary Authority may only state a specified condition that is stated in a preliminary notice under subsection (3)(a).
The Monetary Authority is not obliged to disclose to any person the particulars of a matter that the Monetary Authority has considered in giving an objection notice.

section.name: s8ZZJ
section.heading: Objection to existing controller

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has become a controller of a licensee in the circumstances described in section 8ZZF(4); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: has become a controller of a licensee in circumstances other than those described in that section but the Monetary Authority—

subparagraph.content: has given the person a consent notice under section 8ZZG(3)(a); or
has not given the person an objection notice under section 8ZZG(3)(b).

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may object to the person being such a controller by giving the person an objection notice if the Monetary Authority considers that any of the following conditions (specified conditions) is satisfied—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the person is not or is no longer a fit and proper person to be such a controller;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the interests of the user or potential user of any stored value facility issued, or the issue of which is facilitated, under the licence of the licensee may be in any manner threatened by the person being such a controller;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if applicable, that the person has contravened a condition attached to a consent notice under section 8ZZH.

subsection.leadIn: If the Monetary Authority intends to give an objection notice to a person, the Monetary Authority must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: give a written notice (preliminary notice) to the person stating—

subparagraph.content: the intention; and
the specified condition that the Monetary Authority considers is satisfied; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: state in the preliminary notice that the person may, within 1 month from the receipt of the preliminary notice, make oral or written representations to the Monetary Authority as to why an objection notice should not be given.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority must, before giving an objection notice, take into consideration any representation made in the manner mentioned in subsection (3)(b).
On giving an objection notice to the person, the Monetary Authority must state in the notice the specified condition that the Monetary Authority considers is satisfied.
For the purposes of subsection (5), the Monetary Authority may only state a specified condition that is stated in a preliminary notice under subsection (3)(a).
The Monetary Authority is not obliged to disclose to any person the particulars of a matter that the Monetary Authority has considered in giving an objection notice.

section.name: s8ZZK
section.heading: Prohibition regarding indirect controller

subsection.leadIn: A person is a prohibited person (受禁人) in respect of a licensee for the purposes of this section if the person has been given an objection notice objecting to the person’s becoming or being an indirect controller of the licensee, and either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the period within which, under section 35(2)(b), the person may refer the Monetary Authority’s decision of giving the objection notice to the Tribunal for review has expired without such a reference having been made; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the person referred the decision to the Tribunal for review under section 35(1) but—

subparagraph.content: the review was unsuccessful; or
the reference was abandoned or withdrawn.

subsection.leadIn: A person who is a prohibited person in respect of a licensee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must not act or continue to act as an indirect controller of the licensee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must not give, or must cease to give, as such a controller any directions or instructions to the directors of—

subparagraph.content: the licensee; or
another corporation of which the licensee is a subsidiary.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (4) applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a prohibited person in respect of a licensee gives (whether directly or indirectly) a director of the licensee any directions or instructions that are, or might reasonably be construed as being, prohibited from being so given under subsection (2)(b); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the director knows, or ought reasonably to know, that the person is a prohibited person in respect of the licensee.

subsection.leadIn: The director must, on being given the directions or instructions, notify the Monetary Authority of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the directions or instructions; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the circumstances in which the directions or instructions are given to the director.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on conviction on indictment—

subparagraph.content: to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 5 years; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on summary conviction—

subparagraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: A director who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with subsection (4) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on conviction on indictment—

subparagraph.content: to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on summary conviction—

subparagraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s8ZZL
section.heading: Monetary Authority may require information from controller

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may require a controller of a licensee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to provide the Monetary Authority with any information that the Monetary Authority requires for performing the Monetary Authority’s functions under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to provide the information within the period, and in the manner, required by the Monetary Authority.

subsection.content: If a licensee becomes aware that a person has become, or has ceased to be, a controller of the licensee, the licensee must, within 14 days after the date on which the licensee becomes aware of that fact, notify the Monetary Authority of that fact in writing.

subsection.leadIn: A controller who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a requirement under subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on conviction on indictment—

subparagraph.content: to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $25,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on summary conviction—

subparagraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: A licensee who fails to comply with subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on conviction on indictment—

subparagraph.content: to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on summary conviction—

subparagraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s8ZZM
section.heading: Interpretation of Subdivision 4
section.leadIn: In this Subdivision—
section.def: controller (控權人) means—(a)a majority shareholder controller; or(b)a minority shareholder controller;

specified shares (指明股份), in relation to a person who is a controller of a licensee—(a)if the person became such a controller by acquiring shares in the licensee, means the shares so acquired—(i)that are held by the person or any of the person’s associates; and(ii)that were not so held immediately before the person became such a controller; or(b)if the person became such a controller by the acquisition by the person or any of the person’s associates of shares in another corporation, means the shares so acquired—(i)that are held by the person or any of the person’s associates; and(ii)that were not so held immediately before the person became such a controller.

section.name: s8ZZN
section.heading: Monetary Authority may impose restrictions regarding specified shares in licensee, etc.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a controller of a licensee who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has become such a controller in circumstances other than those described in section 8ZZF(4);

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.leadIn: has been given an objection notice under section 8ZZG(3)(b) and—

subparagraph.content: the period within which, under section 35(2)(b), the person may refer the Monetary Authority’s decision of giving the objection notice to the Tribunal for review has expired without such a reference having been made; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: has been convicted of an offence under section 8ZZF(5); or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: has been given an objection notice under section 8ZZJ(2) and continues to be a controller of the licensee after—

subparagraph.content: the period within which, under section 35(2)(b), the person may refer the Monetary Authority’s decision to the Tribunal for review has expired without such a reference having been made; or
the person referred the decision to the Tribunal for review under section 35(1) but the review was unsuccessful, or the reference was abandoned or withdrawn.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing to the person mentioned in subsection (3), direct that the specified shares of the controller be subject to one or more of the following restrictions until further notice—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: no voting rights carried by those shares are exercisable;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: no further shares are to be issued in right of those shares or pursuant to any offer made to the holder of those shares;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: except in a liquidation, no payment is to be made of any sums due from the licensee, or other corporation to which the shares relate, on the shares, whether in respect of capital or otherwise.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2), the notice is to be given to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the licensee or the other corporation to which the specified shares concerned relate; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the notice relates to specified shares held by an associate of the controller, that associate.

section.name: s8ZZO
section.heading: Monetary Authority may revoke notice given to certain controller under section 8ZZN(2)

subsection.content: This section applies if a notice (restriction notice) has been given under section 8ZZN(2) in respect of the specified shares of a controller of a licensee mentioned in section 8ZZN(1)(b).

The controller may, within 14 days after the restriction notice is given, give a written notice mentioned in section 8ZZG(2) (section 8ZZG(2) notice) to the Monetary Authority as if it were a notice required to be given under that section.
If a section 8ZZG(2) notice is given, this Division applies to the notice as if it were a notice given under section 8ZZG(2).

subsection.leadIn: The restriction notice is revoked if, after the controller gives a section 8ZZG(2) notice—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority gives the person such an objection notice within the permitted notice period but the person refers the decision to the Tribunal for review under section 35(1) and the review is successful.

subsection.leadIn: If a restriction notice is revoked under subsection (4), the Monetary Authority must immediately give a written notice of the revocation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the licensee or the other corporation to which the specified shares concerned relate; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the restriction notice relates to specified shares held by an associate of the controller, that associate.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: permitted notice period (准發通知期), in relation to the giving of an objection notice, means the period within which the Monetary Authority may give an objection notice under section 8ZZG(3)(b).

section.name: s8ZZP
section.heading: Effect of restriction under section 8ZZN

subsection.leadIn: If any specified shares are subject to a restriction mentioned in section 8ZZN(2)(a), the following agreements are void—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an agreement to transfer those shares;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if those shares are unissued shares, an agreement to transfer the right to be issued with those shares.

subsection.leadIn: If any specified shares are subject to a restriction mentioned in section 8ZZN(2)(c) or (d), the following agreements are void—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an agreement to transfer any right to be issued with other shares in right of those shares;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an agreement to receive any payment on those shares (except in a liquidation).

subsection.content: The operation of section 8ZZN(2)(b) does not of itself cause any person to contravene section 8ZZF or 8ZZG.

section.name: s8ZZQ
section.heading: Offences regarding restriction under section 8ZZN(2)

subsection.leadIn: A person must not—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: vote in respect of any shares as holder or proxy knowing that to do so contravenes the restriction;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: appoint a proxy in respect of any shares knowing that to vote in respect of those shares would contravene the restriction;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: being the holder of any shares, fail to give notice that those shares are subject to the restriction, to any other person whom the person—

subparagraph.content: does not know to be aware of the fact; but
does know to be entitled (apart from the restriction) to vote in respect of those shares whether as holder or proxy; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: being the holder of any shares, or being entitled to any right to be issued with other shares in right of them, or any right to receive any payment on them (except in a liquidation), enter into any agreement that is void under section 8ZZP.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (4) applies if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: payments are made by a licensee or any other corporation in contravention of the restriction under section 8ZZN(2)(d).

subsection.leadIn: A chief executive, director or manager of the licensee or the corporation (as the case may be) who knowingly and wilfully permits the issue of the shares or the making of such a payment commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s8ZZR
section.heading: Monetary Authority may apply to Court of First Instance for order regarding sale of specified shares

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), the Monetary Authority may, on the Monetary Authority’s own initiative or on the request of a person under section 8ZZS(1), apply to the Court of First Instance for either or both of the following orders—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an order for the sale of the specified shares of a controller to whom section 8ZZN applies;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the shares are subject to any restriction under section 8ZZN(2), an order that those shares cease to be subject to that restriction.

subsection.leadIn: If the controller is a controller mentioned in section 8ZZN(1)(b), the Monetary Authority must not make an application under subsection (1) unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the application relates to shares that are subject to a restriction under section 8ZZN(2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person to whom the notice under section 8ZZN(2) is given has not, within 14 days after the notice is given, given a written notice mentioned in section 8ZZO(2) to the Monetary Authority.

subsection.content: If the controller mentioned in subsection (2) becomes one that is mentioned in section 8ZZN(1)(c), that subsection does not prevent the Monetary Authority from making an application in respect of the specified shares of the controller by the operation of that section.

If the Court of First Instance makes an order mentioned in subsection (1), it may, on the application of the Monetary Authority, at any time make a further order relating to the sale or transfer of the shares as it thinks fit.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (4), a further order may be an order that the holder of the shares must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cause those shares to be transferred to a nominee of the Monetary Authority specified in the order; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: cause those shares to be so transferred within the period specified in the order.

subsection.content: If any specified shares are sold under an order made under this section, then unless the Court of First Instance otherwise specifies, the proceeds of the sale, less the costs of the sale, are to be paid into court for the benefit of the persons beneficially interested in them.
A person mentioned in subsection (6) may apply to the Court of First Instance for an order that the whole or part of the amount paid into court under that subsection be paid to the person.

section.name: s8ZZS
section.heading: Requesting Monetary Authority to apply to Court of First Instance for order regarding sale of specified shares

subsection.content: If any specified shares are subject to a restriction under section 8ZZN(2), a person affected by the restriction may request the Monetary Authority to make an application to the Court of First Instance under section 8ZZR(1).

subsection.leadIn: If a request is made under subsection (1), the Monetary Authority must, within 1 month after receiving the request—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: comply with the request; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: give a written notice to the person making the request stating that—

subparagraph.content: the Monetary Authority is prevented by section 8ZZR(2) from making the application; or
the Monetary Authority does not propose to make the application.

section.name: s8ZZT
section.heading: Person affected by restriction under section 8ZZN(2) may apply to Court of First Instance for order

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person has made a request to the Monetary Authority under section 8ZZS(1) in respect of specified shares that are subject to a restriction under section 8ZZN(2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.content: the person has received a notice under section 8ZZS(2)(b)(ii) in respect of the request; or
the period mentioned in section 8ZZS(2) has expired but the Monetary Authority has neither complied with the request nor given the person a notice under section 8ZZS(2)(b) in respect of the request.

subsection.leadIn: The person may apply to the Court of First Instance for either or both of the following orders—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an order for the sale of the specified shares to which the request relates;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an order for the shares to be ceased to be subject to any restriction under section 8ZZN(2).

subsection.content: If the Court of First Instance makes an order mentioned in subsection (2), it may, on the application of the Monetary Authority, at any time make a further order relating to the sale or transfer of the shares as it thinks fit.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (3), a further order may be an order that the holder of the shares must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cause those shares to be transferred to a nominee of the Monetary Authority specified in the order; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: cause those shares to be so transferred within the period specified in the order.

subsection.content: If any specified shares are sold under an order made under this section, then unless the Court of First Instance otherwise specifies, the proceeds of the sale, less the costs of the sale, are to be paid into court for the benefit of the persons beneficially interested in them.
A person mentioned in subsection (5) may apply to the Court of First Instance for an order that the whole or part of the amount paid into court under that subsection be paid to the person.

section.name: s8ZZU
section.heading: Appointment of chief executive of licensee

subsection.content: Subject to sections 8ZM(1) and 8ZO(3), a licensee must appoint a person as the chief executive, and at least one person as an alternate chief executive, of the licensee.
Only an individual who is ordinarily resident in Hong Kong may be appointed under subsection (1).

If the person appointed as the chief executive of a licensee is precluded by illness, absence from Hong Kong or any other cause from performing the functions as the chief executive, an alternate chief executive of the licensee is to act as the chief executive of the licensee.

subsection.leadIn: A licensee who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment or on summary conviction, to a fine at level 6; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s8ZZV
section.heading: Consent required for becoming chief executive or director

subsection.content: A person must not become a chief executive or director of a licensee except with the Monetary Authority’s consent.
If a person has become a chief executive or director of a licensee without the Monetary Authority’s consent, the person must not act, or continue to act as such a chief executive or director.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsections (1) and (2), if a person has been given the Monetary Authority’s consent to become a chief executive of a licensee and is such a chief executive, the person may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: become a director of the licensee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: act as such a director without the Monetary Authority’s consent.

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (1) and (2) do not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is appointed as a chief executive or director of a licensee under section 8ZO(3)(a); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person is appointed to serve as such a chief executive or director immediately on the expiry of a previous term by the person as such a chief executive or director.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on conviction on indictment—

subparagraph.content: to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on summary conviction—

subparagraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: consent (同意) means a written consent given by the Monetary Authority under section 8ZZW.

section.name: s8ZZW
section.heading: Monetary Authority may give consent to become chief executive or director of licensee

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority must refuse to give a consent to a person for the purposes of section 8ZZV unless the Monetary Authority is satisfied that the person is a fit and proper person to be a chief executive or director of the licensee concerned.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may require the person—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: to provide the information within the period, and in the manner, required by the Monetary Authority.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: attach to the consent conditions, or any new conditions (including by amending the conditions already attached), that the Monetary Authority considers appropriate for securing, or further securing, that the person will continue to be a fit and proper person to be a chief executive or director of the licensee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: cancel a condition so attached.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may withdraw the consent if the Monetary Authority ceases to be satisfied that the person is a fit and proper person to be a chief executive or director of the licensee.

subsection.leadIn: If the Monetary Authority intends to attach conditions to the consent or withdraw the consent, the Monetary Authority must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: give a written notice to the person and the licensee stating—

subparagraph.content: the intention;
if applicable, the conditions to be attached; and
the grounds for doing so;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: state in the notice that the person may, within 7 days after the giving of the notice, make oral or written representations to the Monetary Authority as to why the grounds for attaching the conditions or withdrawing the consent have not been made out; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: attach to the notice a copy of this section and section 8ZZV.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority must, before making the decision, take into consideration any representation made in the manner mentioned in subsection (5)(b).
The Monetary Authority must, as soon as practicable after making a decision under this section, give a written notice of the decision to the person and the licensee.

subsection.leadIn: A written notice given under subsection (7) must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a decision to give the consent, the decision;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a decision to refuse to give the consent, the decision and the grounds for the decision;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for a decision to withdraw the consent, the decision and the grounds for the decision;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: for a decision to attach conditions—

subparagraph.content: the conditions;
the grounds for attaching the conditions; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: for a decision to cancel a condition, the decision.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes a condition attached under subsection (3) to a consent given to the person commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on conviction on indictment—

subparagraph.content: to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on summary conviction—

subparagraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s8ZZX
section.heading: Monetary Authority may require information from chief executive or director of licensee

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may require a chief executive or director of a licensee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to provide the Monetary Authority with any information that the Monetary Authority requires for performing the Monetary Authority’s functions under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to provide the information within the period, and in the manner, required by the Monetary Authority.

subsection.content: If a licensee becomes aware that a person has become, or has ceased to be, a chief executive or director of the licensee, the licensee must, within 14 days after the date on which the licensee becomes aware of that fact, notify the Monetary Authority of that fact in writing.

subsection.leadIn: A licensee is not required under subsection (2) to give a notification in respect of a person if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is appointed as a chief executive or director of the licensee under section 8ZO(3)(a);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person’s appointment as a chief executive or director of the licensee is regarded as revoked under section 8ZM(1)(a); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person’s appointment as a chief executive or director of the licensee is revoked under section 8ZO(3)(d).

subsection.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a requirement under subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on conviction on indictment—

subparagraph.content: to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $25,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on summary conviction—

subparagraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: A licensee who fails to comply with subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on conviction on indictment—

subparagraph.content: to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on summary conviction—

subparagraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s8ZZY
section.heading: Appointment of manager

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if any of the following events occurs—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person becomes a manager of a licensee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person ceases to be a manager of a licensee;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person, in the capacity as a manager of a licensee, becomes principally responsible (either alone or jointly with others) for the conduct of any of the licensee’s affairs or business specified in Schedule 6 in addition to, or in place of, any other responsibility the person has or had in that capacity.

subsection.leadIn: The licensee must, within 14 days after the date on which any of the events occurs, give a written notice to the Monetary Authority and the person mentioned in subsection (1)(a), (b) or (c) stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date on which the event occurs;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the particulars of the licensee’s affairs or business for which the person becomes or ceases to be responsible as a manager; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: (for a written notice to the Monetary Authority) any other particulars that the Monetary Authority requires for performing the Monetary Authority’s functions under this Ordinance.

subsection.content: Subsection (2) does not apply if the manager is appointed on a temporary basis.

However, if the appointment of the manager subsequently ceases to be on a temporary basis, subsection (2) applies in respect of the manager on and after the date of the cessation as if it were the date on which the event under that subsection occurs.

subsection.leadIn: A licensee who fails to comply with subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on conviction on indictment—

subparagraph.content: to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on summary conviction—

subparagraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s8ZZZ
section.heading: Consent required for certain persons to become employee of licensee

subsection.leadIn: Except with the Monetary Authority’s written consent, a person must not become an employee of a licensee if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is bankrupt;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has entered into a composition or scheme of arrangement with the person’s creditors;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has entered into a voluntary arrangement as defined by section 2 of the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6) with the person’s creditors; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: has been convicted in any place of an offence involving fraud or dishonesty.

subsection.leadIn: Except with the Monetary Authority’s written consent, a person who is or was a chief executive, director or manager of a licensee (first licensee) must not become an employee of another licensee if the person knows, or ought reasonably to know, that—

paragraph.name: a
