paragraph.content: the first licensee is being, or has been, wound up or otherwise dissolved; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the licence of the first licensee has been revoked.

subsection.content: A person who has become an employee of a licensee in contravention of subsection (1) or (2) must cease to act as such an employee.

subsection.leadIn: If the Monetary Authority refuses to give a written consent to a person seeking it for the purposes of subsection (1) or (2), the Monetary Authority must, as soon as practicable, give a written notice to the person stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the grounds for the decision.

subsection.content: If the Monetary Authority has given a written consent to a person seeking it for the purposes of subsection (2), that subsection is not again applicable to the person in respect of the first licensee concerned.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1), (2) or (3) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 1 year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s8ZZZA
section.heading: Consent required for certain persons to continue to act as employee of licensee

subsection.leadIn: Except with the Monetary Authority’s written consent, a person who is an employee of a licensee must cease to act as such if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: becomes bankrupt;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: enters into a composition or scheme of arrangement with the person’s creditors;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: enters into a voluntary arrangement as defined by section 2 of the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6) with the person’s creditors; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: has been convicted in any place of an offence involving fraud or dishonesty.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (3) applies to a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a chief executive, director or manager of a licensee (first licensee); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: knows, or ought reasonably to know, that—

subparagraph.content: the first licensee is being, or has been, wound up or otherwise dissolved; or
the licence of the first licensee has been revoked.

subsection.leadIn: The person must not continue to act as an employee of another licensee unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person has notified the Monetary Authority of the employment together with a request to the Monetary Authority for a written consent to act as such an employee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority has not refused to give the written consent.

subsection.leadIn: If the Monetary Authority refuses to give a written consent to a person seeking it for the purposes of subsection (1) or (3), the Monetary Authority must, as soon as practicable, give a written notice to the person stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the grounds for the decision.

subsection.content: If the Monetary Authority has given a written consent to a person seeking it for the purposes of subsection (3), that subsection is not again applicable to the person in respect of the first licensee concerned.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) or (3) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 1 year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s8ZZZB
section.heading: Stored value facilities exempt from Divisions 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 and 9 of this Part

subsection.content: Subject to section 8ZZZC, a stored value facility specified in Schedule 8 for the purposes of this section is exempt from Divisions 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 and 9 of this Part.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may require the issuer or facilitator of a stored value facility specified in Schedule 8 to provide the Monetary Authority with any information that the Monetary Authority considers necessary for satisfying that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the risks posed by the facility to the user or potential user of the facility are immaterial; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the risks posed by the facility to the payment or financial system of Hong Kong are immaterial.

subsection.content: The issuer or facilitator must provide the information within the period, and in the manner, required by the Monetary Authority.

subsection.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on conviction on indictment—

subparagraph.content: to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; and (Amended E.R. 3 of 2021)
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $25,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on summary conviction—

subparagraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s8ZZZC
section.heading: Monetary Authority may declare stored value facilities not to be exempt under section 8ZZZB

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may, after consulting the Financial Secretary, by notice published in the Gazette, declare that a stored value facility specified in Schedule 8 for the purposes of section 8ZZZB is not exempt from Divisions 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 and 9 of this Part if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority considers that it is necessary in the public interest or in the interests of the user or potential user of the facility to do so; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Monetary Authority is not satisfied that—

subparagraph.content: the risks posed by the facility to the user or potential user of the facility are immaterial; or
the risks posed by the facility to the payment or financial system of Hong Kong are immaterial.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority must specify in the notice the date on which the declaration is to take effect or, if it is to take effect on the occurrence of an event, this fact and the event.

subsection.leadIn: If the Monetary Authority intends to make a declaration in respect of a stored value facility under subsection (1), the Monetary Authority must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: give a written notice to the issuer and (if any) facilitator of the facility stating—

subparagraph.content: the intention; and
the grounds for doing so; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify in the notice a period of not less than 14 days within which the issuer or facilitator may make oral or written representations to the Monetary Authority as to why the grounds for making the declaration have not been made out.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority must, before making the declaration, take into consideration any representation made in the manner mentioned in subsection (3)(b).

subsection.leadIn: On a declaration taking effect in respect of a stored value facility, section 8W applies to the issuer and (if any) facilitator of the facility as if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the facility were a facility issued under a licence granted under section 8F;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if applicable, the issue of the facility were facilitated under a licence granted under section 8F; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the issuer and facilitator each were a licensee whose licence had been revoked under section 8V.

section.name: s8ZZZD
section.heading: Power of Monetary Authority to exempt facility from Divisions 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 and 9 of this Part

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may, by notice published in the Gazette, exempt a stored value facility from Divisions 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 and 9 of this Part.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may only exempt a stored value facility under subsection (1) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the issuer of the facility is a company (issuing company);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there is a facilitator for the issue of the facility, the facilitator is a company (facilitating company); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the Monetary Authority is satisfied that the risks posed by the facility to both of the following are immaterial—

subparagraph.content: the user or potential user of the facility;
the payment or financial system of Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (2)(c), in deciding whether the risks posed by a stored value facility are immaterial, the Monetary Authority may take into consideration any matters that the Monetary Authority considers to be relevant, including—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether the facility is or is to be used by its user only in, or in close proximity to, the premises occupied by the issuing company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the range of goods or services for which the facility may be used by its user as a means of making payments;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the group of people to whom payments may be made by using the facility;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: whether the scheme proposed by the facilitating company to facilitate the issue of the facility is sound, in particular having regard to the matters relating to the security and risk management of the scheme; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: whether the issuing company and the facilitating company are financially sound to perform their respective functions under the schemes mentioned in paragraphs (d) and (e), in particular having regard to the corporate status, amount of paid-up share capital, net assets or profit performance of the companies.

subsection.content: The exemption may be subject to any conditions the Monetary Authority considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (4), the Monetary Authority may attach the following conditions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a condition that the issuing company or facilitating company of the facility concerned must, within the period required by the Monetary Authority, notify the Monetary Authority of the matters relating to the facility as may be required by the Monetary Authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a condition regarding the maximum value of the sums of money or money’s worth that the issuing company may permit the user of the facility to store on the facility.

section.name: s8ZZZE
section.heading: Revocation of exemption under section 8ZZZD

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may, by notice published in the Gazette, revoke an exemption given in respect of a stored value facility under section 8ZZZD on being satisfied that any condition attached under section 8ZZZD(4) in respect of the exemption has been contravened.
The Monetary Authority must specify in the notice the date on which the revocation is to take effect or, if it is to take effect on the occurrence of an event, this fact and the event.

subsection.leadIn: If the Monetary Authority intends to revoke an exemption under subsection (1), the Monetary Authority must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: give a written notice to the issuer and (if any) facilitator of the stored value facility stating—

subparagraph.content: the intention; and
the grounds for doing so; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify in the notice a period of not less than 14 days within which the issuer or facilitator may make oral or written representations to the Monetary Authority as to why the grounds for revoking the exemption have not been made out.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority must, before revoking the exemption, take into consideration any representation made in the manner mentioned in subsection (3)(b).

subsection.leadIn: On a revocation taking effect in respect of a stored value facility, section 8W applies to the issuer and (if any) facilitator of the facility as if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the facility were a facility issued under a licence granted under section 8F;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if applicable, the issue of the facility were facilitated under a licence granted under section 8F; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the issuer and facilitator each were a licensee whose licence had been revoked under section 8V.

section.name: s8ZZZF
section.heading: Monetary Authority to keep register of licensees

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority must establish and keep a register of licensees in the form the Monetary Authority thinks fit.

subsection.leadIn: The register must contain in respect of each licensee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the licensee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the address of the principal place of business in Hong Kong of the licensee; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the licence number of the licence held by the licensee.

subsection.content: The register may also contain any other particulars of a licensee that the Monetary Authority considers appropriate to be contained in the register.

If a licence is revoked under section 8U or 8V, the Monetary Authority must, as soon as practicable after the revocation takes effect, remove from the register the entry relating to the licensee concerned.

subsection.leadIn: If a licence is suspended under section 8Y, 8Z or 8ZA, the Monetary Authority must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as soon as practicable after the suspension, make a notation that the licence has been so suspended in the register against the name of the licensee concerned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ensure that the notation remains on the register until the suspension ceases to have effect.

subsection.leadIn: The register is to be kept at—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the office of the Monetary Authority; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other place notified by the Monetary Authority in the Gazette.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority must make the register available for inspection by the public in the form of an online record.

section.name: s8ZZZG
section.heading: Use of copy, etc. of register of licensees as evidence

subsection.content: This section applies to a document purporting to have been signed and certified by the Monetary Authority as a true copy of an entry in, or an extract from, a register kept under section 8ZZZF.

subsection.leadIn: A document to which this section applies is to be admitted as evidence in criminal or civil proceedings before a court on its production without further proof, and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is prima facie evidence of all matters contained in the document; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the absence of evidence to the contrary, is to be presumed by the court—

subparagraph.content: to have been signed and certified by the Monetary Authority; and
to be a true copy of an entry in, or an extract from, the register of licensees.

section.name: s8ZZZH
section.heading: Winding up of licensee and protection of float

subsection.content: This section does not apply to a licensee that is a bank.
The provisions of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) regarding a creditors’ voluntary winding up do not apply to a licensee.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (4) applies if there is a presentation of a petition for the winding up of a licensee by the Court of First Instance, and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: before the presentation of the petition, there has in respect of the licensee been a direction given under section 8ZH which has continued in force until the presentation of the petition; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a winding-up order is made on the petition.

subsection.content: Despite section 184(2) of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32), the winding up of the licensee is regarded to have commenced at the time the direction was given for the purposes of sections 170, 179, 182, 183, 266, 267, 269, 271(1)(d), (e), (h), (i), (j), (k), (l) and (o) and 274 of that Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Section 182 of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) does not invalidate any disposition of the business or property of a licensee made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the Manager of the licensee, acting in good faith in the course of managing the affairs, business and property of the licensee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by the licensee under the direction of the Manager, acting in good faith in the course of managing the affairs, business and property of the licensee.

section.name: s8ZZZI
section.heading: Display of licence number on stored value facility

subsection.leadIn: A licensee who is an issuer of a stored value facility issued under its licence must ensure that the licence number of the licence is clearly stated—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), if the stored value facility is device-based, on each physical device concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the stored value facility is device-based but it is not reasonably practicable for it to comply with paragraph (a), on the packaging containing each physical device concerned; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the stored value facility is network-based, on each communication network concerned.

subsection.leadIn: A licensee who is a facilitator of a stored value facility the issue of which is facilitated under its licence must ensure that the licence number of the licence is clearly stated—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), if the stored value facility is device-based, on each physical device concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the stored value facility is device-based but it is not reasonably practicable for it to comply with paragraph (a), on the packaging containing each physical device concerned; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the stored value facility is network-based, on each communication network concerned.

subsection.leadIn: A licensee who fails to comply with subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine at level 6; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a stored value facility is device-based if it is in the form of a physical device provided by the issuer to the user and the stored value is stored on the device; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a stored value facility is network-based if—

subparagraph.content: it is not a facility mentioned in paragraph (a).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: communication network (通訊網絡) includes a website of a licensee.

subsection.content: This section does not apply to a stored value facility that is a multi-purpose card issued under the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) before the commencement date* of this section.

section.name: s8ZZZJ
section.heading: Publication of advertisement, etc. relating to stored value facility

subsection.leadIn: A person must not publish in Hong Kong or elsewhere an advertisement, invitation or document mentioned in subsection (3) relating (whether in whole or in part) to the issue of a stored value facility that, under this Ordinance, may only be issued under a licence unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the advertisement, invitation or document relates (whether in whole or in part) to the issue of the facility by a licensee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the licence number of the licence held by the licensee is clearly stated in the advertisement, invitation or document.

subsection.leadIn: A person must not publish in Hong Kong or elsewhere an advertisement, invitation or document mentioned in subsection (3) relating (whether in whole or in part) to the facilitation of the issue of a stored value facility that, under this Ordinance, may only be facilitated under a licence unless—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the licence number of the licence held by the licensee is clearly stated in the advertisement, invitation or document.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsections (1) and (2), the advertisement, invitation or document is an advertisement, invitation or document which to the knowledge of the person is, or contains, an invitation to the public.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine at level 6; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (4) to prove that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person carries on the business of publishing or arranging for the publication of advertisement, invitation or document;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person received the advertisement, invitation or document in the ordinary course of business; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: at the time the person published or arranged for the publication of the advertisement, invitation or document, the person believed on reasonable grounds that—

subparagraph.content: for a contravention of subsection (2), the advertisement, invitation or document related to the facilitation of the issue of a stored value facility by a licensee; or
for a contravention of either subsection (1) or (2), the stored value facility concerned was exempt under section 8ZZZB or 8ZZZD.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: publish (發布), in relation to any advertisement, invitation or document, includes issuing, circulating, distributing or otherwise disseminating the advertisement, invitation or document, whether—(a)by any visit in person;(b)in a newspaper, magazine, journal or other periodical publication;(c)by the display of posters or notices;(d)by means of circulars, brochures, pamphlets or handbills;(e)by an exhibition of photographs or cinematography films;(f)by way of sound broadcasting or television;(g)by computer or other electronic device; or(h)by any other means, whether mechanically, electronically, magnetically, optically, manually or by any other medium, or by way of production or transmission of light, image or sound or any other medium,and also includes causing or authorizing the advertisement, invitation or document to be published.

section.name: s8ZZZK
section.heading: False claims to be stored value facility issuer or facilitator

subsection.leadIn: A person who is not a licensee must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: describe themselves, in whatever terms, as a licensee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: behave, or otherwise hold themselves out, in a manner which indicates, or which is reasonably likely to be understood as indicating, that they are such a person.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on conviction on indictment—

subparagraph.content: to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on summary conviction—

subparagraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

part.name: P2B
part.heading: Matters Pertaining to Functions and Powers of Monetary Authority

section.name: s9
section.heading: Functions of Monetary Authority

subsection.leadIn: It is the function of the Monetary Authority under this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: to monitor compliance with the obligations imposed under this Ordinance in relation to—

subparagraph.content: designated systems; and
stored value facilities; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: to promote the general safety and efficiency of—

subparagraph.content: designated systems; and
stored value facilities. (Replaced 18 of 2015 s. 19)

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), it is the function of the Monetary Authority— (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 19)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to take reasonable steps to satisfy himself that every designated system and stored value facility is operated in a safe and efficient manner;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to promote and encourage proper standards of operation and sound and prudent practices amongst designated systems and stored value facilities;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whenever appropriate, to co-operate with and assist recognized financial services supervisory authorities of Hong Kong or of any place outside Hong Kong in maintaining and promoting safety and efficiency in the operations of designated systems and stored value facilities; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: to consider and propose reforms of the law relating to— (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 19)

subparagraph.content: payment systems and stored value facilities; and
the operation of designated systems and stored value facilities. (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 19)

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may appoint persons as advisers or consultants to assist him in the performance of his functions under this Ordinance.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Power of Chief Executive to give directions

subsection.content: After consulting the Monetary Authority, the Chief Executive may, on being satisfied that it is in the public interest to do so, give the Monetary Authority such written directions as he thinks fit as to the performance of any function of the Monetary Authority under this Ordinance.
The Monetary Authority shall comply with any direction given under subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: If a direction is given under subsection (1), a requirement in an Ordinance that the Monetary Authority shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: form any opinion;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be satisfied as to any matter (including the existence of particular circumstances); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: consult any person,

subsection.continued: for the purpose of performing any function to which the direction relates, does not apply for any purpose connected with the performance of that function pursuant to or consequent upon the direction.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Power of Monetary Authority to exempt designated system established outside Hong Kong

subsection.content: This section applies to a designated system that is established in a place outside Hong Kong and is under the supervision of an authority exercising functions in that place similar to the functions of the Monetary Authority under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Monetary Authority is satisfied that the scope and nature of the supervision exercised in relation to any designated system to which this section applies by the authority in the place outside Hong Kong is sufficient to achieve any or all of the objectives of this Part and Part 2 in relation to the system, the Monetary Authority may exempt a person from— (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 20)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any or all of the obligations imposed on the person under the provisions in this Part and Division 2 of Part 2 in relation to the system; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any obligation arising from the exercise of any power conferred under those provisions in relation to the system. (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 20)

subsection.content: In addition to any exemption granted under subsection (2) in relation to a designated system, the Monetary Authority may exempt the system operator or settlement institution of the designated system from the application of section 30 or 53, or may exempt the participants of the system from the application of section 31; and where such an exemption in relation to section 30, 31 or 53 is in effect, that section shall not apply in relation to the system operator, settlement institution or participants to whom the exemption applies.

Where the Monetary Authority has granted (or has varied or withdrawn) an exemption under this section in any case, he shall publish in the Gazette notice of the particulars of that grant (or variation or withdrawal) of exemption.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Monetary Authority may request information or documents from system operator, settlement institution, participant or licensee

subsection.leadIn: For the better performance of the Monetary Authority’s functions under this Ordinance, the Monetary Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by notice in writing given to a system operator or settlement institution of, or participant in, a designated system, request the system operator, settlement institution or participant to give the Monetary Authority information or documents relating to the system as may be specified in the notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by notice in writing given to the licensee who issues, or facilitates the issue of, a stored value facility under its licence, request the licensee to give the Monetary Authority information or documents relating to the facility as may be specified in the notice. (Replaced 18 of 2015 s. 21)

subsection.content: A request made under subsection (1) may specify a period, being a period that is reasonable in the circumstances, within which the request shall be complied with.

subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the power conferred by subsection (1) to request information or documents relating to a designated system or stored value facility includes the power to request any information or documents that the Monetary Authority considers necessary to determine whether there is or has been compliance with the provisions of this Ordinance in relation to the system or facility; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a request made under subsection (1) may specify the giving of information or documents on a periodic basis or at any time and regardless of whether the Monetary Authority has reason to suspect that there is, has been or may be a failure to comply with a provision of this Ordinance in relation to the system or facility. (Replaced 18 of 2015 s. 21)

subsection.leadIn: A person who fails to comply with a request made under subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on conviction on indictment—

subparagraph.content: to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on summary conviction—

subparagraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues. (Added 18 of 2015 s. 21)

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (4) to prove that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the request to which the charge relates concerns an aspect of the management or operation of the designated system or stored value facility that is not an aspect for which the person is responsible; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person took all reasonable steps to ensure that the request to which the charge relates was complied with. (Added 18 of 2015 s. 21)

section.name: s12A
section.heading: Monetary Authority may examine books, accounts and transactions

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may at any time, with or without prior notice to a specified person, examine any books, accounts or transactions of the person.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified person (指明人士) means—(a)a system operator of a designated system;(b)a settlement institution of a designated system;(c)a participant in a designated retail payment system; or(d)a licensee, or a subsidiary of a licensee, that is not a bank.

section.name: s12B
section.heading: Monetary Authority may require report to be prepared by auditor

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may, after consulting a specified person, by notice in writing require the person to submit to the Monetary Authority a report—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (4), prepared by one or more auditors appointed by the person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prepared on the matters that the Monetary Authority may require for discharging or exercising the Monetary Authority’s duties and powers under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the period within which the report is to be submitted; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the manner in which the report is to be prepared.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1)(b), the report may be prepared on the following matters—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: whether or not the specified person has in place adequate systems of control to enable, as far as reasonably practicable—

subparagraph.content: the person’s affairs, business and property to be prudently managed; and
the person to discharge the person’s duties imposed under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: A specified person may only appoint the following person to be an auditor for preparing a report required under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person approved by the Monetary Authority for preparing the report; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person amongst the persons nominated by the Monetary Authority for preparing the report.

subsection.leadIn: A person who fails to comply with a requirement under subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on conviction on indictment—

subparagraph.content: to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $25,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on summary conviction—

subparagraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified person (指明人士) means—(a)a system operator of a designated system;(b)a settlement institution of a designated system;(c)a participant in a designated system; or(d)a licensee, or a subsidiary of a licensee, that is not a bank;
systems of control (管控制度) includes procedures of control.

section.name: s12C
section.heading: Licensee and subsidiary to produce books, etc. for examination

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), for the purpose of an examination by the Monetary Authority under section 12A in respect of a specified person that is a licensee or a subsidiary of a licensee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the person must permit the Monetary Authority to have access to—

subparagraph.content: the person’s books and accounts;
the documents of title to the person’s assets and other documents;
the securities held by the person in respect of the transactions of the person’s customers and the person’s cash; and
any facilities (including photocopying facilities) and information as may be required for the purpose of the examination; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person must produce to the Monetary Authority its books, accounts, documents, securities, cash, facilities or information that the Monetary Authority may require for the examination.

subsection.content: In so far as is consistent with the carrying out of an examination, a person is not required under subsection (1) to provide for inspection any thing at a time or place that would interfere with the proper conduct of the normal daily business of the person.

subsection.leadIn: A person who fails to comply with subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on conviction on indictment—

subparagraph.content: to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 1 year; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on summary conviction—

subparagraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Monetary Authority may give directions

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: direct a system operator or settlement institution of a designated system to take the action that the Monetary Authority considers necessary for bringing the designated system into compliance with the requirements set out in section 7(1)(a), (b), (c) or (d); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: direct a licensee to take the action that the Monetary Authority considers necessary for bringing any stored value facility issued, or the issue of which is facilitated, under its licence into compliance with the requirements set out in section 8O(1). (Replaced 18 of 2015 s. 23)

subsection.leadIn: A direction given under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must specify the action to be taken; (Replaced 18 of 2015 s. 23)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for subsection (1)(a), must include a statement of the respect in which the Monetary Authority considers the designated system not to be in compliance with a requirement set out in section 7(1)(a), (b), (c) or (d); (Replaced 18 of 2015 s. 23)

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: for subsection (1)(b), must include a statement of the respect in which the Monetary Authority considers the stored value facilities not to be in compliance with a requirement set out in section 8O(1); and (Added 18 of 2015 s. 23)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may specify a period, being a period that is reasonable in the circumstances, within which the direction shall be complied with.

subsection.leadIn: A person who fails to comply with a direction given under subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on conviction on indictment—

subparagraph.content: to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on summary conviction—

subparagraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and
in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues. (Added 18 of 2015 s. 23)

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (3) to prove that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the direction to which the charge relates concerns an aspect of the management or operation of the designated system or stored value facility that is not an aspect for which the person is responsible; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person took all reasonable steps to ensure that the direction to which the charge relates was complied with. (Added 18 of 2015 s. 23)

section.name: s14
section.heading: Monetary Authority may impose operating rules

subsection.content: Without affecting the generality of section 13, the Monetary Authority may by notice in writing given to a system operator or settlement institution of a designated system direct that the operating rules of the system be amended in such manner as the Monetary Authority considers necessary to bring the operating rules into compliance with section 7(1)(b).

subsection.leadIn: A direction given under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall specify the amendment to be effected;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall include a statement of the respect in which the Monetary Authority considers the operating rules of the system not to be in compliance with section 7(1)(b); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may specify a period, being a period that is reasonable in the circumstances, within which the amendment shall be effected, and may require that within a further period of 3 days a copy of the relevant part of the operating rules as so amended shall be provided to the Monetary Authority as confirmation of compliance with the direction.

subsection.leadIn: Without affecting the generality of subsection (1), a direction under that subsection to amend a designated system’s operating rules may include a direction to amend those rules by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: adding a rule specified in the direction;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: amending a particular rule in the manner specified in the direction; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: deleting a rule specified in the direction.

subsection.content: Before giving a direction under subsection (1), the Monetary Authority shall consult the Financial Secretary and the system operator or settlement institution to whom the direction relates.

If there is any failure to comply with a direction given under this section, the Monetary Authority may by notice published in the Gazette declare that the operating rules of the designated system shall be amended in the manner specified in the direction, and the operating rules of the system shall as from the time of publication of such have effect as if they had been so amended.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 3

subsection.leadIn: In this Part, other than section 26, a reference to the law of insolvency shall be construed as a reference to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Parts V, VI and X of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32); (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: Part 15 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); and (Added 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other written law or rule of law of Hong Kong which is concerned with or in any way related to the bankruptcy, winding up or insolvency of a person,

subsection.continued: or, for the purposes of the application by a court in Hong Kong (in accordance with the rules of private international law) of the laws of a place outside Hong Kong, as a reference to any written law or rule of law of the place outside Hong Kong which is concerned with or in any way related to the bankruptcy, winding up or insolvency of a person.

subsection.content: In this Part, unless the context otherwise requires, a reference to bankruptcy or winding up shall be construed as a reference to bankruptcy or winding up under the laws of Hong Kong.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Monetary Authority may issue certificate of finality

subsection.leadIn: Where a clearing and settlement system has been designated under Part 2, the Monetary Authority shall determine in accordance with subsection (2) whether the following criteria are met as regards that system, namely—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: ultimate settlement of transfer orders is effected within the system itself; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is compliance with the requirements stipulated in section 7(1).

subsection.leadIn: In making a determination under subsection (1) the Monetary Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall have regard to such information relating to the system as may be submitted to him by the system operator for the purposes of this section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may in addition have regard to such other information in his possession relating to the system as he considers relevant,

subsection.continued: but the Monetary Authority shall not be under any obligation to undertake any enquiries for the purpose of making the determination.

subsection.content: If the Monetary Authority determines that the criteria specified in subsection (1) have been met as regards a designated clearing and settlement system, the Monetary Authority must issue in respect of the system a certificate certifying to that effect (certificate of finality) and specifying a date and time from which the certificate shall have effect.

If the Monetary Authority finds himself unable to make a determination in the terms mentioned in subsection (3) as regards a designated clearing and settlement system, the Monetary Authority must inform the system operator in writing accordingly giving particulars of the respect in which any of the criteria specified in subsection (1) have not been met or of the further information he requires in order to make a determination in relation to such criteria.

Except for the period of any suspension under section 17(1), a certificate of finality in respect of a designated clearing and settlement system remains in effect until it is revoked or until the designation of the system for the purposes of this Ordinance has been revoked.

Except as otherwise provided, the following provisions of this Part apply to and in relation to any designated clearing and settlement system in respect of which a certificate of finality is in effect; and in Divisions 3, 4 and 5 of this Part, a reference to a designated system is a reference to such a designated clearing and settlement system.
The Monetary Authority shall publish in the Gazette notice of any certificate of finality issued under this section.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Suspension or revocation of certificate of finality

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may at any time by notice in writing, with effect from a date and time specified in the notice, suspend or revoke a certificate of finality in respect of a designated system if he is of the opinion that, as regards that system—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: there has been any contravention of section 6(2), 7(3), 12, 13, 14, 45 or 53(4).

subsection.leadIn: Before suspending or revoking a certificate of finality under this section the Monetary Authority shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notify in writing the system operator and settlement institution of his intention to suspend or revoke the certificate of finality and the grounds on which the suspension or revocation is to be made; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: allow such period as is specified in the notice, being a period of not less than 14 days, within which the system operator or settlement institution may be heard or may make representations as to why the certificate of finality should not be suspended or revoked.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority shall publish in the Gazette notice of any suspension or revocation of a certificate of finality effected under this section.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Finality of Transactions and Proceedings within Designated Systems

section.name: s18
section.heading: Scope of modification of law of insolvency under this Division

subsection.leadIn: The law of insolvency shall have effect in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: transfer orders effected through a designated system;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: action taken under the operating rules of a designated system with respect to such orders; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: collateral security,

subsection.continued: subject to the provisions of this Division.

subsection.content: This Division shall apply in relation to bankruptcy and winding up proceedings in respect of a participant, but shall not apply in relation to bankruptcy and winding up proceedings in respect of any person who is not a participant.

For the avoidance of doubt, notwithstanding that rights or liabilities arising from transfer orders as mentioned in subsection (1)(a) are or may be dealt with in bankruptcy and winding up proceedings, this Division shall not apply to such proceedings if they are in respect of any person who is not a participant.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Transfers and settlements within designated systems are final

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to any transfer or settlement of the following description that is effected through a designated system the operating rules of which provide that such a transfer or settlement is final and irrevocable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a transfer of funds into or out of an account of a participant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a settlement of a payment obligation; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a settlement of an obligation for the transfer of book-entry securities, or the transfer of such securities.

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in any written law or rule of law, a transfer or settlement to which this section applies shall not be liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be reversed, repaid or set aside; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to an order made by a court for the rectification or stay of such transfer or settlement.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Proceedings of designated systems take precedence over law of insolvency

subsection.leadIn: None of the following shall be regarded as to any extent invalid on the ground of inconsistency with the law of insolvency regarding distribution of the assets of a person on bankruptcy or winding up, or on the appointment of a liquidator, trustee in bankruptcy or equivalent officer over any of the assets of a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a transfer order;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any disposition of property in pursuance of a transfer order;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the default arrangements of a designated system;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the operating rules of a designated system as to the settlement of transfer orders not dealt with under its default arrangements; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a contract for the purpose of realizing collateral security in connection with participation in a designated system otherwise than pursuant to its default arrangements.

subsection.leadIn: The powers of a relevant insolvency office-holder in his capacity as such and the powers of a court under the law of insolvency, shall not be exercised in such a way as to prevent or interfere with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the settlement of a transfer order in accordance with the operating rules of a designated system not dealt with under its default arrangements;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any action taken under the default arrangements of a designated system; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any action taken to realize collateral security in connection with participation in a designated system otherwise than pursuant to its default arrangements.

subsection.content: A debt or other liability arising out of a transfer order which is the subject of action taken under default arrangements may not be proved in a bankruptcy or winding up until the completion of the action taken under default arrangements.

A debt or other liability which by virtue of subsection (3) may not be proved shall not be taken into account for the purposes of any set-off until the completion of the action taken under default arrangements.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Abrogation of statutory provisions relating to disclaimer of property, restriction on dispositions of property, etc.
section.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of section 20—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 59 of the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6) and section 268 of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) shall not apply to a transfer order; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 42 of the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6) and section 182 of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) shall not apply to a transfer order or any disposition of property in pursuance of such an order.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Abrogation of statutory powers relating to adjustment of prior transactions

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of section 20, no order shall be made by a court under any of the following provisions in respect of a transfer order or any disposition of property in pursuance of such an order— (Amended 14 of 2016 s. 188)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 49 or 50 of the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 265D or 266 of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32); (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920; 14 of 2016 s. 188)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: section 60 of the Conveyancing and Property Ordinance (Cap. 219).

subsection.content: In subsection (1)(b), the reference to section 266 of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) includes that section as in force immediately before the commencement date* of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) (Amendment) Ordinance 2016 (14 of 2016). (Added 14 of 2016 s. 188)

section.name: s23
section.heading: Net sum payable on completion of default arrangements provable in insolvency proceedings

subsection.content: This section shall apply with respect to any net sum owed by or to a defaulting participant on the completion of the action taken under default arrangements.

subsection.leadIn: Where a court has made an order for bankruptcy or winding up of a participant, or where a resolution for voluntary winding up of a participant has been passed or a directors’ voluntary winding up statement in respect of a participant has taken effect, the net sum referred to in subsection (1) shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: provable in the bankruptcy or winding up or, as the case may be, payable to the relevant insolvency office-holder; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: taken into account, where appropriate, under section 35 of the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6) (as regards the bankruptcy) or under that section as applied under the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) (as regards the winding up).

subsection.content: Subsection (2) applies notwithstanding section 34 or 35 of the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6) and section 264 of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32).

section.name: s24
section.heading: Transfer orders entered into designated system after insolvency not affected

subsection.leadIn: This Division shall not apply in relation to any transfer order given by a participant in a designated system which is entered into the designated system after—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the expiry of the day on which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a court makes an order for bankruptcy or winding up of the participant;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a resolution for voluntary winding up of the participant is passed; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a directors’ voluntary winding up statement in respect of the participant takes effect; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the receipt by the system operator of notice of the event specified in paragraph (a),

subsection.leadIn: Reference in subsection (1) to the expiry of the day on which an event specified in subsection (1)(a) occurs in relation to a participant in a designated system is a reference to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the expiry of that day according to Hong Kong time; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the expiry of the same calendar day according to local time in the place where the designated system is established,

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(b), a system operator shall be taken to have received notice of an event mentioned in subsection (1)(a) if he deliberately failed to make enquiries as to that matter in circumstances in which a reasonable and honest person would have done so.

division.name: D4
division.heading: Netting of Obligations of Insolvent Participants

section.name: s25
section.heading: Netting may be effected

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a court has made an order for bankruptcy or winding up of a participant in a designated system;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a resolution for voluntary winding up of a participant in a designated system has been passed; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a directors’ voluntary winding up statement in respect of a participant in a designated system has taken effect,

subsection.continued: then, notwithstanding any provision of the law of insolvency, the system operator of the designated system may effect the netting of all obligations owed to or by the participant incurred up to the point of time that applies for the purposes of section 24(1).

subsection.leadIn: Where any netting has been effected as provided in subsection (1), then—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the obligations that are netted shall be disregarded in the bankruptcy or winding up proceedings; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any net obligation owed to or by the participant that has not been discharged—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is payable to the participant and may be recovered for the benefit of his creditors; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is provable in the bankruptcy or winding up,

subsection.content: A netting effected as provided in subsection (1) and any payment made by a participant as provided in subsection (2) shall not be voidable in the bankruptcy or winding up proceedings.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Law of insolvency in other jurisdictions

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding any law to the contrary, a court shall not recognize or give effect to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an order of a court exercising jurisdiction under the law of insolvency in a place outside Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an act of a person appointed in a place outside Hong Kong to perform a function under the law of insolvency there,

subsection.continued: in so far as the making of the order or doing of the act would be prohibited under this Part for a court in Hong Kong or a relevant insolvency office-holder.

subsection.def: In subsection (1), law of insolvency (破產清盤法), in relation to a place outside Hong Kong, means any written law or rule of law of the place which is concerned with or in any way related to the bankruptcy, winding up or insolvency of a person.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Preservation of rights, etc. in underlying transactions

subsection.leadIn: This Part shall not operate to limit, restrict or otherwise affect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any right, title, interest, privilege, obligation or liability of a person resulting from the underlying transaction in respect of a transfer order which has been entered into a designated system; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any investigation, legal proceedings or remedy in respect of any such right, title, interest, privilege, obligation or liability.

subsection.leadIn: Nothing in subsection (1) shall be construed to require—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the unwinding of any netting effected by the system operator of a designated system, whether pursuant to its default arrangements or otherwise;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: the reversal of a payment or settlement made under the operating rules of a designated system.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Right of relevant insolvency office-holder to recover gain from transaction at undervalue between 2 participants

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to any transaction between 2 participants in a designated system that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is entered into at an undervalue to the gain of one of the participants (first participant); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: was entered into at any time during the period of 6 months ending with—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the presentation of a petition for the bankruptcy or winding up of the other participant (second participant) or his principal;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the passing of a resolution for voluntary winding up of the second participant or his principal; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the making of a directors’ voluntary winding up statement in respect of the second participant or his principal.

subsection.content: A relevant insolvency office-holder acting in respect of the second participant to a transaction to which this section applies or his principal may, unless a court otherwise orders, recover from the first participant to the transaction an amount equivalent to the gain made from the transaction.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, a transaction is entered into at an undervalue if it is entered into—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on terms that provide for the second participant or his principal to receive no consideration; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a consideration the value of which, in money or money’s worth, is less than the value, in money or money’s worth, of the consideration provided by the second participant or his principal.

subsection.content: At the request of a system operator or settlement institution of a designated system the Monetary Authority may, by notice published in the Gazette, exempt the system operator or settlement institution from the application of this section; and where such an exemption is in effect this section shall not apply in respect of any transaction entered into by the system operator or settlement institution (as the case may be) as first participant in his capacity as such system operator or settlement institution.
For the avoidance of doubt, nothing in this section has the effect of derogating from section 20(2) or 22.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Right of relevant insolvency office-holder to recover transfer between 2 participants giving unfair preference

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to any transfer of funds or securities from one participant in a designated system to another, being—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a transfer to which section 19 applies (other than a transfer that forms part of a transaction to which section 28 applies);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a transfer by which the participant who is the recipient of the transfer (first participant) is given an unfair preference by the participant making the transfer (second participant) or by the principal of the second participant acting through the second participant; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a transfer that is effected at any time during the period of 6 months ending with—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: the passing of a resolution for voluntary winding up of the second participant or his principal; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the making of a directors’ voluntary winding up statement in respect of the second participant or his principal.

subsection.content: A relevant insolvency office-holder acting in respect of the second participant to a transfer to which this section applies or his principal may, unless a court otherwise orders, recover from the first participant to the transfer an amount equivalent to the value of the transfer.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, a transfer is a transfer as described in subsection (1)(b) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the first participant is a creditor of, or is a surety or guarantor for any debts or liabilities of, the second participant or his principal;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the transfer has the effect of putting the first participant into a position which, in the event of the bankruptcy or winding up of the second participant or his principal, will be a better position than the position he would have been in if the transfer had not been made; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the second participant in deciding to make the transfer, or the second participant’s principal in deciding to cause him to make the transfer, is influenced by a desire to produce in relation to the first participant, the effect described in paragraph (b).

subsection.content: At the request of a system operator or settlement institution of a designated system the Monetary Authority may, by notice published in the Gazette, exempt the system operator or settlement institution from the application of this section; and where such an exemption is in effect this section shall not apply in respect of any transfer effected by the system operator or settlement institution (as the case may be) as first participant in his capacity as such system operator or settlement institution.
For the avoidance of doubt, nothing in this section has the effect of derogating from section 20(2) or 22.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Duty to report on completion of default proceedings

subsection.content: The system operator and settlement institution of a designated system shall, not later than 6 days after the completion of any action taken under the default arrangements of the system in respect of a defaulting participant, together prepare in writing and give to the persons specified in subsection (3) a report (default proceedings report) on such action taken.

subsection.leadIn: A default proceedings report—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall state the net sum (if any) certified by the system operator or settlement institution to be payable by or to the defaulting participant, or the fact that no sum is so payable (as the case may be); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may contain such other particulars in respect of the action taken as the system operator and settlement institution consider appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: The persons specified for the purposes of subsection (1) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any relevant insolvency office-holder acting in relation to the defaulting participant to whom the report relates or that defaulting participant’s estate or, if there is no such relevant insolvency office-holder, the defaulting participant to whom the report relates.

subsection.content: Where the Monetary Authority receives pursuant to subsection (1) a default proceedings report he may publish notice of that fact in such manner as he considers appropriate to bring it to the attention of creditors of the defaulting participant to whom the report relates.

subsection.leadIn: A relevant insolvency office-holder or defaulting participant who has received pursuant to subsection (1) a default proceedings report, shall, if so requested by a creditor of the defaulting participant to whom the report relates—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make the report (or a copy of it) available for inspection by the creditor; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: supply to the creditor all or any part of that report (or a copy of it), subject to receipt of payment of such reasonable fee as the relevant insolvency office-holder or defaulting participant (as the case may be) determines.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 1 year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Added 18 of 2015 s. 27)

section.name: s31
section.heading: Obligation of participant to notify of bankruptcy or winding up

subsection.leadIn: A participant in a designated system shall notify the system operator of the system and the Monetary Authority forthwith if there comes to his knowledge any of the following circumstances occurring in Hong Kong, or any analogous circumstances occurring outside Hong Kong, namely—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the presentation of a petition for the bankruptcy or winding up of the participant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the making of an order for bankruptcy or winding up of the participant;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the passing of a resolution for voluntary winding up of the participant; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the making of a directors’ voluntary winding up statement in respect of the participant.

subsection.content: A failure by a participant to notify a system operator or the Monetary Authority of a relevant event referred to in subsection (1) within the time required under that subsection is not a contravention of that subsection if the system operator or Monetary Authority (as the case may be) was already aware of the relevant event by that time.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes this section commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Added 18 of 2015 s. 28)

section.name: s32
section.heading: Order releasing relevant insolvency office-holder from obligations in relation to default proceedings
section.content: A court may, on an application by a relevant insolvency office-holder, make such order as it considers appropriate altering or releasing him from compliance with the functions of his office to the extent that those functions are affected by the fact that action under default arrangements is being or could be taken, or has been or could have been taken.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Enforcement of judgments over property of participant as judgment debtor

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to any property of a participant in a designated system that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been provided as collateral security in favour of a system operator or settlement institution of the system; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is held by or deposited with that system operator or settlement institution for the purpose of securing liabilities arising directly in connection with the clearing or settlement of those transfer orders issued by the participant.

subsection.leadIn: Except with the consent of the system operator or settlement institution mentioned in subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no execution or other legal process for the enforcement of a judgment or order shall be commenced or continued; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no distress shall be levied,

subsection.continued: in respect of property to which this section applies; but this subsection does not apply to a person seeking to enforce any interest in or security over the property.

subsection.content: Where by virtue of subsection (2) a person would not be entitled to enforce a judgment or order against any property, any injunction or other remedy granted with a view to facilitating the enforcement of any such judgment or order shall not extend to that property.

section.name: s33A
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 3A
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: investigation (調查) means an investigation under section 33B.

section.name: s33B
section.heading: Investigation by Monetary Authority

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if the Monetary Authority has reasonable cause to believe that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an offence under this Ordinance may have been committed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a requirement imposed under this Ordinance may have been contravened; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a condition attached to a licence, consent or any other instrument granted or given by the Monetary Authority under this Ordinance may have been contravened.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: direct in writing one or more of the persons appointed under section 5A(3) of the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66) to investigate a matter mentioned in subsection (1)(a), (b) or (c); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: with the consent of the Financial Secretary, appoint in writing one or more other persons to investigate a matter mentioned in subsection (1)(a), (b) or (c).

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority must give an investigator a copy of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the direction if the investigator is directed under subsection (2)(a); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the appointment if the investigator is appointed under subsection (2)(b).

subsection.content: The costs and expenses incurred by an investigator may be paid out of the Exchange Fund established under section 3 of the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66).

section.name: s33C
section.heading: Power of investigator to require production of record or document, etc.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person in relation to whom an investigator is directed or appointed to investigate a matter under section 33B;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person whom an investigator has reasonable cause to believe—

subparagraph.content: to be in possession of a record or document that contains, or is likely to contain, information relevant to an investigation; or
to be otherwise in possession of information relevant to an investigation.

subsection.leadIn: An investigator may, by notice in writing, require a person to whom this section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: produce to the investigator, within the time and at the place specified in the notice, a record or document specified in the notice that—

subparagraph.content: is or may be relevant to the investigation; and
is in the person’s possession; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: attend before the investigator at the time and place specified in the notice, and answer any question relating to a matter under investigation that may be asked by the investigator.

subsection.content: An investigator may require a person to whom this section applies to give the investigator all assistance in connection with the investigation that the person is reasonably able to give, including responding to a written question that may be raised by the investigator.

If a person produces a record or document in compliance with a requirement imposed under subsection (2)(a), the investigator may require the person to give the investigator an explanation or further particulars in respect of the record or document.

Before imposing a requirement on a person under subsection (2), (3) or (4), an investigator must produce a copy of the direction or appointment given by the Monetary Authority under section 33B(3) for inspection by the person.

section.name: s33D
section.heading: Power of investigator to require answer, etc. be verified by statutory declaration

subsection.leadIn: An investigator may, by notice in writing, require a person who gives an answer, statement, explanation or particulars to the investigator under section 33C(2), (3) or (4)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to verify by statutory declaration the answer, statement, explanation or particulars; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to do so within a reasonable period specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: If a person does not produce a record or document, or give an answer, statement, explanation or particulars, to an investigator in accordance with a requirement imposed under section 33C(2), (3) or (4) for the reason that the record or document, or the information concerned, is not within the person’s knowledge or in the person’s possession, the investigator may, by notice in writing to the person, require the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to verify by statutory declaration that fact and reason; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to do so within a reasonable period specified in the notice.

subsection.content: A statutory declaration under subsection (1) or (2) may be taken by the investigator.

Before imposing a requirement on a person under subsection (1) or (2), an investigator must produce a copy of the direction or appointment given by the Monetary Authority under section 33B(3) for inspection by the person.

section.name: s33E
section.heading: Report by investigator

subsection.leadIn: An investigator—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may give interim reports to the Monetary Authority on the investigation for which the investigator is directed or appointed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must give the interim reports to the Monetary Authority as soon as practicable after being directed by the Monetary Authority to do so.

subsection.content: An investigator must, as soon as practicable after completing the investigation for which the investigator is directed or appointed, give a final report to the Monetary Authority on the investigation.
The Monetary Authority may, with the consent of the Secretary for Justice, publish a report given under this section.

section.name: s33F
section.heading: Offence for contravention of section 33C or 33D

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if the person, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a requirement imposed on the person under section 33C(2), (3) or (4) or 33D(1) or (2).

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in purported compliance with a requirement imposed on the person under section 33C(2), (3) or (4)—

subparagraph.content: produces a record or document that is false or misleading in a material particular; or
gives an answer, statement, explanation or particulars that are false or misleading in a material particular; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: knows that, or is reckless as to whether, the record or document, or the answer, statement, explanation or particulars, are false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person with intent to defraud—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fails to comply with a requirement imposed on the person under section 33C(2), (3) or (4) or 33D(1) or (2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in purported compliance with a requirement imposed on the person under section 33C(2), (3) or (4)—

subparagraph.content: produces a record or document that is false or misleading in a material particular; or
