gives an answer, statement, explanation or particulars that are false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.leadIn: An officer or employee of a corporation commits an offence if the officer or employee with intent to defraud—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: causes or allows the corporation to fail to comply with a requirement imposed on the corporation under section 33C(2), (3) or (4) or 33D(1) or (2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: causes or allows the corporation to, in purported compliance with a requirement imposed on the corporation under section 33C(2), (3) or (4)—

subparagraph.content: produce a record or document that is false or misleading in a material particular; or
give an answer, statement, explanation or particulars that are false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 1 year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (2) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (3) or (4) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.content: A person is not excused from complying with a requirement imposed on the person under section 33C(2), (3) or (4) or 33D(1) or (2) only on the ground that to do so might tend to incriminate the person.

subsection.leadIn: Despite anything in this Ordinance, no criminal proceedings may be instituted against a person under subsection (1), (2), (3) or (4) for a conduct if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: proceedings have previously been instituted against the person for the purposes of section 33G(2)(b) for the same conduct; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.content: those proceedings are pending; or
because of the previous institution of those proceedings, no proceedings may again be lawfully instituted against the person for the purposes of that section for the same conduct.

subsection.content: If a person is convicted by a court on a prosecution instituted as a result of an investigation, the court may order the person to pay to the Monetary Authority the whole or part of the costs and expenses of the investigation.

section.name: s33G
section.heading: Investigator may apply to Court of First Instance to inquire into failure to comply with requirement

subsection.content: If a person fails to comply with a requirement imposed on the person by an investigator under section 33C(2), (3) or (4) or 33D(1) or (2), the investigator may apply to the Court of First Instance for an inquiry into the failure.

subsection.leadIn: On an application under subsection (1), the Court of First Instance may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on being satisfied that there is no reasonable excuse for the person not to comply with the requirement, order the person to comply with the requirement within the period specified by the Court; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on being satisfied that the failure was without reasonable excuse, punish the person, and any other person knowingly involved in the failure, in the same manner as if the person and that other person had been guilty of contempt of court.

subsection.content: An application under subsection (1) must be made by an originating summons in Form No. 10 in Appendix A to the Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A).

subsection.leadIn: Despite anything in this Ordinance, no proceedings may be instituted against a person for the purposes of subsection (2)(b) for a conduct if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: criminal proceedings have previously been instituted against the person under section 33F(1), (2), (3) or (4) for the same conduct; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.content: those criminal proceedings are pending; or
because of the previous institution of those criminal proceedings, no criminal proceedings may again be lawfully instituted against the person under that section for the same conduct.

section.name: s33H
section.heading: Use of incriminating evidence in proceedings

subsection.content: If an investigator requires a person to answer or respond to a question, or to give an explanation or further particulars, under section 33C(2), (3) or (4), the investigator must ensure that the person has first been informed or reminded of the limitations imposed by the application of subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: Despite anything in this Ordinance, and subject to subsection (3), if an investigator requires a person to answer or respond to a question, or to give an explanation or further particulars, under section 33C(2), (3) or (4), the requirement and the following are not admissible in evidence against the person in criminal proceedings in a court of law—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the question and the answer or response;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the explanation or particulars.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) applies only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the answer, response, explanation or particulars might tend to incriminate the person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person so claims before giving the answer, statement, explanation or particulars; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the criminal proceedings are not those in which the person is charged with an offence in respect of the answer, statement, explanation or particulars—

subparagraph.content: under this Part;
under section 36(5) for a contravention of section 36(3)(a);
under Part V of the Crimes Ordinance (Cap. 200); or
for perjury.

section.name: s33I
section.heading: Lien claimed on record or document
section.leadIn: If a person claims a lien on a record or document in the person’s possession that is required to be produced under this Part—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the lien does not affect the requirement to produce the record or document;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no fees are payable in relation to the production; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the production does not affect the lien.

section.name: s33J
section.heading: Issue of magistrate’s warrant

subsection.leadIn: On information on oath laid by a person specified in subsection (2), a magistrate may, if satisfied that the condition in subsection (3) is met, issue a warrant authorizing a person specified in the warrant, a police officer, and any other person as may be necessary to assist in executing the warrant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to enter the premises specified in the information, if necessary by force, at any time within the period of 7 days beginning on the date of the warrant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to search for, seize and remove a record or document that the person specified in the warrant or the police officer has reasonable cause to believe may be required to be produced under this Part.

subsection.leadIn: Each of the following persons is specified for the purposes of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an investigator;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person appointed under section 5A(3) of the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66).

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1), the condition is that there are reasonable grounds to suspect that there is, or is likely to be, on the premises a record or document that may be required to be produced under this Part.

section.name: s33K
section.heading: Powers of person authorized by warrant, and related offences

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized person has reasonable cause to believe that a person on the premises is employed in connection with a business that is or has been carried on on the premises, the authorized person may require that person to produce for examination a record or document that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is in the possession of that person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the authorized person has reasonable cause to believe may be required to be produced under this Part.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized person may, in relation to a record or document required to be produced under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: prohibit a person found on the premises from—

subparagraph.content: removing the record or document from the premises;
erasing anything from, adding anything to or otherwise altering anything in, the record or document; or
otherwise interfering in any manner with, or causing or permitting any other person to interfere with, the record or document; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: take any other step that appears to the authorized person to be necessary for—

subparagraph.content: preserving the record or document; or
preventing interference with the record or document.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a requirement or prohibition under subsection (1) or (2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: obstructs an authorized person in the exercise of a power conferred by subsection (1) or (2) on the authorized person.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (3) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: authorized person (獲授權人) means a person authorized by a warrant issued under section 33J(1) to carry out the acts set out in paragraphs (a) and (b) of that section.

section.name: s33L
section.heading: Record or document removed by person authorized by warrant

subsection.leadIn: A record or document removed under section 33J may be retained—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a period not exceeding 6 months beginning on the day of its removal; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the record or document is or may be required for any criminal proceedings or any proceedings under this Ordinance, for any longer period that may be necessary for those proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized person removes a record or document under section 33J, the authorized person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must, as soon as practicable after the removal, give a receipt for the record or document; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: may permit a person who would be entitled to inspect the record or document but for the removal, at all reasonable times—

subparagraph.content: to inspect it; and
to make copies or otherwise record details of it.

subsection.content: Section 102 of the Criminal Procedure Ordinance (Cap. 221) applies to any property that has because of this section come into the possession of the Monetary Authority, as it applies to property that has come into the possession of the police.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: authorized person (獲授權人) means a person authorized by a warrant issued under section 33J(1) to carry out the acts set out in paragraphs (a) and (b) of that section.

section.name: s33M
section.heading: Production of information in information system, etc.

subsection.content: This section applies if any information contained in a record or document required to be produced under this Part is not recorded in a legible form.

subsection.leadIn: The power to require the production of the record or document includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the information can be reproduced in a legible form, a power to require the production of the information in a legible form; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the information is recorded in an information system, a power to require the production of that recording in a form that enables the information to be reproduced in a legible form.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: information system (資訊系統) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Electronic Transactions Ordinance (Cap. 553).

subsection.content: In this section, a reference to a recording of any information includes the relevant part of the recording.

section.name: s33N
section.heading: Inspection of record or document seized, etc.

subsection.content: This section applies if an investigator has taken possession of a record or document under this Part.

subsection.leadIn: The investigator must permit a person who would be entitled to inspect the record or document had the investigator not taken possession of it under this Part, at all reasonable times—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to inspect it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to make copies or otherwise record details of it.

subsection.content: The investigator may in giving the permission impose any reasonable conditions as to security or otherwise that the investigator thinks fit.

section.name: s33O
section.heading: Prohibition on destruction, etc. of record or document

subsection.content: This section applies to a person who is required to produce a record or document by another person (requesting person) under this Part.

The person must not destroy, falsify, conceal or otherwise dispose of, or cause or permit the destruction, falsification, concealment or disposal of, the record or document with intent to conceal, from the requesting person, facts or matters capable of being disclosed by the record or document.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s33P
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 3B
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: regulated person (受規管者) means—(a)a system operator of a designated system;(b)a settlement institution of a designated system;(c)a participant in a designated system;(d)a licensee or an officer of a licensee; or(e)if the system operator or settlement institution is a corporation, an officer of a corporation.

section.name: s33Q
section.heading: Monetary Authority may impose sanction on regulated person

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing, impose one or more of the sanctions specified in subsection (2) against a regulated person after having regard to the matters specified in subsection (3), if the Monetary Authority is satisfied that the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has contravened a provision of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has contravened a requirement imposed under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has contravened a condition attached to a licence, consent or any other instrument granted or given by the Monetary Authority under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The sanctions specified for subsection (1) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: to order the regulated person to pay a pecuniary penalty not exceeding the amount that is the greater of—

subparagraph.content: 3 times the amount of profit gained or loss avoided by the person as a result of the contravention;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: to give the regulated person one or more of the following—

subparagraph.content: a caution;
a warning;
a reprimand;
an order to take, by a date specified in the order, the action specified in the order for remedying the contravention;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: to prohibit the regulated person from doing all or any of the following for the period, or until the occurrence of the event, specified in the notice—

subparagraph.content: making an application under section 8E;
giving a written notice under section 8ZZG(2);
seeking a consent mentioned in section 8ZZW(1);
seeking a consent mentioned in section 8ZZZ(1) or (2).

subsection.leadIn: The matters specified for subsection (1) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the circumstances in which the contravention occurred, including the factors occasioning it;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the seriousness of the contravention;

paragraph.name: c
d
e
f
g
paragraph.content: the duration of the contravention;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: if applicable, the continuation of the contravention after the regulated person was notified of an investigation mentioned in paragraph (c);
the extent to which the regulated person knew, or ought to have known, that the contravention had occurred or was occurring;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: the extent and timeliness of any steps taken to cease the contravention and any steps taken for remedying the consequences of the contravention;

paragraph.name: k
m
n
paragraph.content: if applicable, the absence, ineffectiveness or repeated failure of internal mechanisms or procedures of the regulated person intended to prevent contraventions of this Ordinance from occurring.

subsection.content: In reaching a decision to impose a sanction mentioned in subsection (2)(a) or (b), the Monetary Authority may have regard to any information or material in the Monetary Authority’s possession that is relevant to the decision, regardless of how the information or material has come into the Monetary Authority’s possession.

section.name: s33R
section.heading: Procedural requirement for imposing sanction under section 33Q

subsection.leadIn: If the Monetary Authority intends to impose a sanction on a regulated person in respect of a contravention under section 33Q(1), the Monetary Authority must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: give a written notice to the person stating—

subparagraph.content: the intention; and
the grounds for doing so; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify in the notice a period of not less than 14 days within which the person may make oral or written representations to the Monetary Authority as to why the grounds for imposing the sanction have not been made out.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority must, before imposing the sanction, take into consideration any representation made in the manner mentioned in subsection (1)(b).

subsection.leadIn: If the Monetary Authority decides to impose a sanction on a regulated person by notice in writing under section 33Q(1), the Monetary Authority must in the notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: set out the particulars of why the Monetary Authority is satisfied that the person has committed the contravention;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: state the sanction imposed; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for a sanction mentioned in section 33Q(2)(a), state the amount of the pecuniary penalty to be paid.

section.name: s33S
section.heading: Payment of pecuniary penalty mentioned in section 33Q(2)(a)

subsection.leadIn: A regulated person who is ordered to pay a pecuniary penalty mentioned in section 33Q(2)(a) must pay the penalty to the Monetary Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within 30 days; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: within a longer period that the Monetary Authority may specify in the notice mentioned in section 33R(3) to the person.

subsection.content: The Court of First Instance may, on the application of the Monetary Authority made in the manner prescribed for the purposes of this section, register an order made under section 33Q(2)(a) in the Court of First Instance.

The order is, on registration under subsection (2), to be regarded for all purposes as an order of the Court of First Instance made within the civil jurisdiction of the Court of First Instance for the payment of money.
A pecuniary penalty paid or recovered under an order made under section 33Q(2)(a) must be paid into the general revenue.

section.name: s33T
section.heading: Monetary Authority’s power to take further action

subsection.content: This section applies if the Monetary Authority is considering exercising a power against a regulated person under this Part.

The Monetary Authority may, by agreement with the regulated person, take any further action in respect of the person that the Monetary Authority considers appropriate in the circumstance, whether in place of or in addition to the exercise of the power.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may take further action under subsection (2) only if the Monetary Authority considers it appropriate to do so having regard to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the public interest; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the regulated person is a licensee, the interests of the user or potential user of any stored value facility issued, or the issue of which is facilitated, by the licensee under its licence.

subsection.content: If the Monetary Authority exercises the power under subsection (2) in respect of a regulated person, the Monetary Authority is not, subject to the agreement with the regulated person, obliged to comply with section 33R.

section.name: s33U
section.heading: Monetary Authority may give public notice of imposition of sanction
section.leadIn: If a sanction has been imposed on a regulated person under section 33Q(1), the Monetary Authority may disclose to the public—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the details of the sanction imposed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reasons for imposing the sanction; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any material facts relating to the case.

section.name: s33V
section.heading: Application of sanction in relation to former regulated person

subsection.content: This section applies to a power that is exercisable by the Monetary Authority under section 33Q or 33T in relation to a regulated person in connection with a contravention committed by the person.

The power is also exercisable by the Monetary Authority in relation to a person who was a regulated person at the time of the contravention, regardless of whether the person is a regulated person at the time when the power is being exercised.
This Part is to be construed accordingly.

section.name: s33W
section.heading: Application of sanction in relation to officer of corporation

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority exercises a power under section 33Q or 33T in relation to a regulated person that is a corporation in connection with a contravention committed by the person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.content: in committing the contravention, the corporation is aided, abetted, counselled, procured or induced by an officer of the corporation or a person purporting to act as an officer of the corporation; or

the contravention is committed with the consent or connivance of, or is attributable to the recklessness on the part of, an officer of the corporation or a person purporting to act as an officer of the corporation.

subsection.content: The power is also exercisable by the Monetary Authority in relation to the officer or the person purporting to act as such as if the officer or the person were a regulated person.
This Part is to be construed accordingly.

section.name: s33X
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 4
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: applicant (申請人), in relation to any proceedings under this Part, means the person who refers a decision to the Tribunal for review under section 35(1);
reviewable decision (可覆核決定) means a decision or determination specified in Part 2 of Schedule 1.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Establishment of Payment Systems and Stored Value Facilities Appeals Tribunal

subsection.content: There is established by this section a tribunal to be known as the “Payment Systems and Stored Value Facilities Appeals Tribunal” in English and “支付系統及儲值支付工具上訴審裁處” in Chinese. (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 31)

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of reviewing any decision referred to the Tribunal under this Part, the Tribunal is to consist of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Chairman of the Tribunal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such number of persons, not being fewer than 2, from the panel referred to in subsection (4) as the Financial Secretary may, on the recommendation of the Chairman of the Tribunal, appoint for that purpose.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive shall, on the recommendation of the Chief Justice, appoint to be the Chairman of the Tribunal a person who is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a judge, or a deputy judge, of the Court of First Instance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a former Justice of Appeal of the Court of Appeal; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a former judge, or a former deputy judge, of the Court of First Instance.

subsection.content: The Chief Executive shall appoint a panel of persons, not being public officers, whom he considers suitable for appointment as members of the Tribunal.

The Chairman of the Tribunal (except where the Chairman is a judge, or a deputy judge, of the Court of First Instance), and members, of the Tribunal may be paid, as a fee for their services, such amount as the Chief Executive considers appropriate. Those amounts payable to the Chairman of the Tribunal shall be a charge on the general revenue, and those amounts payable to the members shall be a charge on the Exchange Fund established under section 3 of the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66).
Part 1 of Schedule 1 has effect with respect to the Tribunal. (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 31)
Subject to this section and Part 1 of Schedule 1 and to rules made under section 40, the Chairman of the Tribunal may determine the procedures and practice of the Tribunal. (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 31)

section.name: s35
section.heading: Review of decisions by Tribunal

subsection.content: Any person who is aggrieved by a reviewable decision may refer the decision to the Tribunal for review. (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 32)

subsection.leadIn: A reference to the Tribunal under subsection (1) by a person aggrieved is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be made in writing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: to be made—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: if the reference relates to a decision of the Monetary Authority under section 4(1) or (4B), 5(1), 8ZZZC(1), 8ZZZD(1) or 8ZZZE(1), within 30 days after publication in the Gazette of the notice referred to in that section;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the reference relates to any other decision of the Monetary Authority, within 30 days after receiving notice in writing given by the Monetary Authority informing him of the decision,

paragraph.continued: or within such further time as the Tribunal may, in the circumstances of any particular case, think fit; and (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 32)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to state the grounds for the review.

subsection.content: The Tribunal shall deliver to the Monetary Authority a copy of any reference under subsection (1) that it has received.
A reference under subsection (1) does not suspend the decision to which the reference relates.

As soon as practicable after receipt of a copy of a reference delivered under subsection (3), the Monetary Authority shall forward a copy of the decision to which the reference relates together with all other relevant papers in his possession to the Tribunal.

subsection.leadIn: On receipt of the copy of the decision, and of the papers, forwarded under subsection (5), the Tribunal shall review the decision in question and, after taking into account the stated grounds for the review, may make its determination to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: confirm, vary or set aside the decision; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: remit the matter to the Monetary Authority with any direction that it considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: In reviewing a decision of the Monetary Authority, the Tribunal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall afford both the applicant and the Monetary Authority an opportunity of being heard; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may determine that any matter of fact has been established if it has been established on the balance of probabilities.

subsection.content: As soon as practicable after completing the review, the Tribunal shall deliver its determination made under subsection (6), with the reasons for its determination.

A determination made by the Tribunal shall be recorded in writing and signed by the Chairman of the Tribunal, and shall then be registered in the Court of First Instance; and a determination so registered shall be deemed to be an order of the Court.
The determination of the Tribunal is final and is not subject to appeal except on a point of law.

For the purposes of any proceedings in a court of law, a document purporting to be a determination of the Tribunal that is signed by the Chairman of the Tribunal shall, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, be regarded as a determination of the Tribunal duly made, without proof of its making, or proof of signature, or proof that the person signing the determination was in fact the Chairman of the Tribunal.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Powers of Tribunal

subsection.leadIn: In relation to a review of a decision of the Monetary Authority under this Ordinance, the Tribunal may—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: determine the manner in which any such material is received;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by notice in writing signed by the Chairman of the Tribunal, require a person to attend before it and, subject to subsection (2), to give evidence and produce any article, record or document in his possession or control relating to the subject matter of the review;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: administer oaths;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: examine or cause to be examined on oath or otherwise a person attending before it and require the person to answer truthfully any question which the Tribunal considers appropriate for the purpose of the review;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: order a witness to provide evidence for the purpose of the review by affidavit;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: order a person not to publish or otherwise disclose any material produced to the Tribunal;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: prohibit the publication or disclosure of any material the Tribunal receives at any sitting, or any part of a sitting, that is held in camera;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: stay any of the proceedings in the review on such grounds and on such terms and conditions as it considers appropriate having regard to the interests of justice;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: determine the procedure to be followed in connection with the review;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: order that costs be paid to any party to the review or any person who is required to attend before it for the purpose of the review;

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: hear an application for stay of proceedings for a review at any time before its determination is made; and

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: exercise such other powers or make such other orders as may be necessary for or ancillary to the conduct of the review or the performance of its functions.

subsection.leadIn: Nothing in subsection (1)(c), (e) or (f) empowers the Tribunal to require—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the banker or financial adviser of an applicant to disclose any information relating to the affairs of any person other than the applicant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a solicitor or counsel to disclose any privileged communication, whether oral or written, made to or by him in that capacity.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fail to comply with an order, notice, prohibition or requirement of the Tribunal made or given under or pursuant to subsection (1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: disrupt any sitting of the Tribunal or otherwise misbehaves during any such sitting;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: having been required by the Tribunal under subsection (1) to attend before the Tribunal, leave the place where his attendance is so required without the permission of the Tribunal;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: hinder or deter any person from attending before the Tribunal, giving evidence or producing any article, record or document, for the purpose of a review;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: threaten, insult or cause any loss to be suffered by any person who has attended before the Tribunal, on account of such attendance; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: threaten, insult or cause any loss to be suffered by the Chairman, or any member, of the Tribunal at any time on account of the performance of his functions in that capacity.

subsection.content: A person is not excused from complying with an order, notice, prohibition or requirement of the Tribunal made or given under or pursuant to subsection (1) only on the ground that to do so might tend to incriminate the person.

subsection.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Added 18 of 2015 s. 33)

section.name: s37
section.heading: Use of incriminating evidence given under compulsion
section.leadIn: Notwithstanding any other provisions of this Ordinance, where the Tribunal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: requires a person to give evidence under section 36(1)(c);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: requires a person to answer any question under section 36(1)(e);

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: otherwise requires or orders a person to provide any information under section 36(1)(m),

section.continued: and the evidence, answer or information might tend to incriminate the person, then the requirement or order as well as the evidence, the question and answer, or the information shall not be admissible in evidence against the person in criminal proceedings in a court of law other than those in which the person is charged with an offence under section 36(3)(a), or under Part V of the Crimes Ordinance (Cap. 200), or for perjury, in respect of the evidence, answer or information.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Contempt dealt with by Tribunal

subsection.content: The Tribunal has the same powers as the Court of First Instance to punish for contempt.

Without limiting the generality of the powers of the Tribunal under subsection (1), the Tribunal has the same powers as the Court of First Instance to punish for contempt, as if it were contempt of court, a person who, without reasonable excuse, commits any conduct falling within section 36(3).

The Tribunal shall, in the exercise of its powers to punish for contempt under this section, adopt the same standard of proof as the Court of First Instance in the exercise of the same powers to punish for contempt.

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding anything in this section or any other provision of this Ordinance, no power may be exercised under or pursuant to this section to determine whether to punish any person for contempt in respect of any conduct in the following case, namely—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if criminal proceedings have previously been instituted against the person under section 36(3) in respect of the same conduct; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: those criminal proceedings remain pending; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by reason of the previous institution of those criminal proceedings, no criminal proceedings may again be lawfully instituted against that person under that section in respect of the same conduct.

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding anything in this section or any other provision of this Ordinance, no criminal proceedings may be instituted against any person under section 36(3) in respect of any conduct in the following case, namely—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if any power has previously been exercised under or pursuant to this section to determine whether to punish the person for contempt in respect of the same conduct; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: proceedings arising from the exercise of such power remain pending; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by reason of the previous exercise of such power, no power may again be lawfully exercised under or pursuant to this section to determine whether to punish the person for contempt in respect of the same conduct.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Appeal to Court of Appeal

subsection.content: An applicant or the Monetary Authority may, if dissatisfied with a determination delivered under section 35(8), appeal to the Court of Appeal against the determination on a point of law.

Where an appeal has been lodged under subsection (1) the Court of Appeal may, on application made to it, order a stay of execution of the determination of the Tribunal, subject to such conditions as to costs, payment of money into the Tribunal or otherwise as the Court of Appeal considers appropriate; but the lodging of an appeal under subsection (1) does not of itself operate as a stay of execution of the determination of the Tribunal.
The Court of Appeal may affirm, set aside or vary the determination appealed against, or may remit the matter in question to the Tribunal with such directions as it considers appropriate.
The Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A) apply in relation to such an appeal to the extent that those Rules are not inconsistent with this Ordinance.
In an appeal under this section, the Court of Appeal may make such order for payment of costs as it considers appropriate.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Power of Chief Justice to make rules
section.leadIn: The Chief Justice may make rules—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: providing for matters of procedure, or other matters, relating to requests for review, or reviews, under this Part, which are not provided for in this Part or section 4 of Part 1 of Schedule 1;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: providing for the issue or service of any document (however described) for the purposes of this Part or section 4 of Part 1 of Schedule 1; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: prescribing anything required to be prescribed under this Part or section 4 of Part 1 of Schedule 1.

section.name: s45
section.heading: Giving false information to Monetary Authority

subsection.leadIn: A person who, in giving information to the Monetary Authority in pursuance of an obligation under Part 2, 2A or 2B or section 31 or 52— (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 36)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: gives information that is false or misleading in a material particular; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: knows or ought to know that the information being given is false or misleading,

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Added 18 of 2015 s. 36)

section.name: s46
section.heading: Misrepresentation in respect of designated system

subsection.content: A person shall not describe or otherwise make any representation in respect of a payment system that is not a designated system in terms that indicate, or that could reasonably be construed as indicating, that the system is a designated system. (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 37)
It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (1) to prove that he reasonably believed that the system was a designated system.

A person shall not describe or otherwise make any representation in respect of a clearing and settlement system in respect of which a certificate of finality is not in effect in terms that indicate, or that could reasonably be construed as indicating, that a certificate of finality is in effect in respect of the system.
It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (3) to prove that he reasonably believed that a certificate of finality was in effect in respect of the system.
Subsections (1) and (3) do not apply in relation to any description or representation contained in information submitted to the Monetary Authority under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Any person who contravenes subsection (1) or (3) commits an offence and is liable— (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 37)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 37)

section.name: s47
section.heading: False entry in document

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if, wilfully and with intent to deceive, he does any act mentioned in subsection (2) and that act results in any information contained in the book of record or relevant document in question being incorrect or misleading in a material respect.

subsection.leadIn: A person does an act referred to in subsection (1) if he—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: makes, or causes to be made, an entry that he knows or ought reasonably to know to be false in any book of record or in any relevant document relating to a designated system or stored value facility;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: omits to make an entry in any book of record or in any relevant document relating to a designated system or stored value facility; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: alters, abstracts, conceals or destroys an entry in any book of record or in any relevant document relating to a designated system or stored value facility, or causes any such entry to be altered, abstracted, concealed or destroyed.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable— (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 38)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 5 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: In this section— (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 38)
subsection.def: relevant document (有關文件), in relation to a designated system or stored value facility, means a report, slip, document or statement of the business, affairs, transactions, condition, assets or accounts of the system or facility.

section.name: s48
section.heading: Liability of company officers
section.leadIn: Where an offence under this Ordinance is committed by a corporation and— (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 39)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in committing the offence the corporation is aided, abetted, counselled, procured or induced by an officer of the corporation or a person purporting to act as such; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the offence is committed with the consent or connivance of, or is attributable to any recklessness on the part of, an officer of the corporation or a person purporting to act as such,

section.continued: then that officer of the corporation or person purporting to act as such (as well as the corporation) commits the offence and is liable to be proceeded against and punished accordingly.

section.name: s49
section.heading: Power of Monetary Authority to make regulations

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may make regulations for the better carrying out of the purposes of this Ordinance after consulting—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in so far as the regulations relate to designated systems—

subparagraph.content: the Financial Secretary; and
the system operators and settlement institutions of designated systems;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in so far as the regulations relate to stored value facilities—

subparagraph.content: the Financial Secretary; and
the licensees of stored value facilities. (Replaced 18 of 2015 s. 40)

subsection.leadIn: In particular, regulations made under subsection (1) may provide for all or any of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: measures to be put in place for a designated system or stored value facility for the purposes of monitoring and enforcing compliance with the operating rules of the system or facility and the provisions of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: measures in relation to the availability to a designated system or stored value facility of financial resources;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: matters to be provided for under the operating rules of a designated system or stored value facility, including matters conducive to the better safety and efficiency of the system or facility;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other matter necessary or desirable for the better safety and efficiency of operation and financial soundness of designated systems or stored value facilities;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any matter that shall or may be prescribed under this Ordinance. (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 40)

subsection.leadIn: Regulations made for the purpose of this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may be of general or special application and may apply only in specified circumstances;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may make different provisions for different circumstances and provide for different cases or classes of cases; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may provide for the exercise of discretion in such cases as may be specified in those regulations.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Confidentiality

subsection.leadIn: Except in so far as is necessary for the performance of any function under this Ordinance or for carrying into effect any provision of this Ordinance, every person to whom this subsection applies—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: shall not communicate any such matter to any person other than the person to whom such matter relates; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: shall not suffer or permit any person to have access to any records in his possession, custody or control.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority and any person appointed under section 5A(3) of the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66) to assist the Monetary Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person performing a function under this Ordinance or carrying into effect a provision of this Ordinance; and (Replaced 18 of 2015 s. 41)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person who assists a person mentioned in paragraph (b) (assisted person) in performing the assisted person’s function under this Ordinance, or in carrying into effect a provision of this Ordinance. (Added 18 of 2015 s. 41)

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: to the disclosure of information—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: in connection with any other legal proceedings arising out of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
d
e
paragraph.content: to the disclosure of information to any person within the category of persons specified in subsection (2), where the disclosure will enable or assist that person to assist the Monetary Authority in the performance of any of the functions referred to in section 5A(2) of the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: to the disclosure of information to the Tribunal;

paragraph.name: fa
fb
fc
paragraph.content: to the disclosure of information by the Monetary Authority to a resolution authority for the purpose of enabling or assisting the resolution authority to perform its functions under the Financial Institutions (Resolution) Ordinance (Cap. 628); (Added 23 of 2016 s. 226 and E.R. 2 of 2017)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: to the disclosure of information to any person or body who may be appointed or established by the Chief Executive to review processes or procedures adopted by the Monetary Authority in making decisions under this Ordinance in so far as those decisions relate to or affect— (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 41)

subparagraph.content: the designated systems specified in Schedule 2;
the designated systems in which the Monetary Authority has a legal or beneficial interest; or
stored value facilities;

paragraph.name: ga
paragraph.content: if the condition specified in subsection (6) is satisfied, to the disclosure of information to a public officer authorized by the Financial Secretary under subsection (8); (Added 18 of 2015 s. 41)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: to the disclosure of information with the consent of the person from whom the information was obtained or received or, where the information does not relate to such person, with the consent of the person to whom it relates;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: to the disclosure of information which has been made available to the public by virtue of being disclosed in any circumstances in which, or for any purpose for which, disclosure is not precluded by this section; or

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: to the disclosure of information to the Commissioner as defined by section 1 of Part 2 of Schedule 1 to the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorist Financing Ordinance (Cap. 615). (Added 18 of 2015 s. 41. Amended 4 of 2018 s. 48)

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply to any disclosure of information, being a disclosure that is not contrary to the public interest, of the following description—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: disclosure of information to the Securities and Futures Commission referred to in section 3(1) of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571) if, in the opinion of the Monetary Authority, such disclosure will assist the Securities and Futures Commission in exercising its functions; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: disclosure of information to an authority in a place outside Hong Kong exercising in that place functions similar to the functions of the Monetary Authority under this Ordinance, being an authority that is subject to secrecy provisions in that place that in the opinion of the Monetary Authority are adequate, if in the opinion of the Monetary Authority such disclosure will—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: assist that authority in exercising those functions; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: help maintain and promote safety and efficiency in the operation of designated systems or stored value facilities.

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.leadIn: If information is disclosed under subsection (1), or in any of the circumstances mentioned in subsection (3) (other than subsection (3)(a), (h) or (i)) or (4)(a), the person to whom the information is so disclosed, or any other person obtaining or receiving the information, whether directly or indirectly, from the person to whom the information is so disclosed, must not disclose the information or any part of it to any other persons unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority consents to the disclosure;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the information or the part of it has already been made available to the public;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the disclosure is for the purpose of seeking advice from, or giving advice by, counsel or a solicitor or other professional adviser acting or proposing to act in a professional capacity in connection with any matter arising under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the disclosure is in accordance with an order of a court, or in accordance with a law or requirement made under a law. (Added 18 of 2015 s. 41)

subsection.name: 4B
subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (1), the Monetary Authority may disclose information to an authority in a place outside Hong Kong if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that authority performs functions in that place broadly comparable to those of a resolution authority in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the opinion of the Monetary Authority—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that authority is subject to adequate secrecy provisions in that place; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the information is necessary to enable or assist that authority to perform functions in that place broadly comparable to those of a resolution authority in Hong Kong. (Added 23 of 2016 s. 226)

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may attach any conditions that the Monetary Authority considers appropriate in disclosing any information in the circumstances mentioned in subsection (3) or (4B) or in giving a consent under subsection (4A)(a). (Replaced 18 of 2015 s. 41. Amended 23 of 2016 s. 226)

subsection.leadIn: The condition referred to in subsection (3)(ga) is that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is desirable or expedient that the information should be disclosed in the public interest; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the disclosure will enable or assist the recipients of the information to perform their functions and the disclosure is not contrary to the public interest. (Added 18 of 2015 s. 41)

subsection.content: Subsection (3)(h) does not require the Monetary Authority to disclose in, or in relation to, any civil proceedings any information that the Monetary Authority may disclose, or has disclosed, under that subsection. (Added 18 of 2015 s. 41)
The Financial Secretary may authorize a public officer as a person to whom information may be disclosed under subsection (3)(ga). (Added 18 of 2015 s. 41)

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Added 18 of 2015 s. 41)

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (4A) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Added 18 of 2015 s. 41)

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: knows that a condition referred to in subsection (5) has been attached to—

subparagraph.content: a disclosure of information made under subsection (3); or
a consent given under subsection (4A)(a); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contravenes, or aids, abets, counsels or procures any person to contravene, that condition. (Added 18 of 2015 s. 41)

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (11) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Added 18 of 2015 s. 41)

section.name: s51
section.heading: Immunity

subsection.leadIn: No civil liability shall be incurred by any of the following persons as a result of anything done or omitted to be done by him in good faith in the exercise or purported exercise of any functions conferred or imposed by or under this Ordinance, namely—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any public officer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any person appointed under section 5A(3) of the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66) to assist the Monetary Authority;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any person appointed under section 9(3); or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an investigator. (Added 18 of 2015 s.42)

subsection.leadIn: No civil liability shall be incurred by any of the following persons as a result of anything done or omitted to be done by him in good faith in the carrying out or purported carrying out of any directions given to him by the Monetary Authority, namely—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any system operator or settlement institution of a designated system, or any employee of such person;

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: a licensee, or an officer or employee of a licensee; and (Added 18 of 2015 s.42)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in addition, where the system operator or settlement institution of a designated system is a corporation, any officer of the corporation.

section.name: s52
section.heading: Power of Monetary Authority to require information to be given

subsection.content: Where there are reasonable grounds for believing that a payment system exists, but the Monetary Authority is unable on the basis of the information before him to determine whether the system is eligible to be designated or, if eligible to be, should be designated under this Ordinance, the Monetary Authority may by notice in writing request any person who is or whom he reasonably believes to be a system operator or settlement institution of the system or a participant in the system, to give the Monetary Authority such information or documents regarding the system as the Monetary Authority considers may assist him in making that determination.

subsection.leadIn: A request under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall specify the information or documents to be given; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may specify a period, being a period that is reasonable in the circumstances, within which the information or documents shall be given.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to and in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a payment system that is established in a place outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an individual who is outside Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a corporation that is incorporated in a place outside Hong Kong,

subsection.continued: as it applies to and in relation to such a payment system that is established in Hong Kong, such an individual who is in Hong Kong, or such a corporation that is incorporated in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a request made under subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 1 year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Added 18 of 2015 s. 43)

section.name: s52A
section.heading: Legal professional privilege

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), this Ordinance does not affect any claims, rights or entitlements that would, apart from this Ordinance, arise on the ground of legal professional privilege.

Subsection (1) does not affect any requirement made under this Ordinance to disclose the name and address of a client of a legal practitioner (whether or not the legal practitioner is qualified in Hong Kong to practise as counsel or to act as a solicitor).

section.name: s53
section.heading: Requirement to give information relating to default

subsection.content: Where any action has been taken under the default arrangements of a designated system in respect of a participant in the system, the Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing given to the system operator or settlement institution of the system, direct the system operator or settlement institution to give to any person who has responsibility for any matter arising out of or connected with the default of the participant (nominated official) such information as the nominated official may request relating to that default or to any matter arising out of or connected with that default.
A notice given under subsection (1) shall specify the nominated official and the participant to whom the direction relates.

subsection.leadIn: A request for information made by a nominated official shall be in writing and shall state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the information requested; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a period, being a period that is reasonable in the circumstances, within which the information shall be given.

subsection.content: A system operator or settlement institution to whom a request is made in accordance with subsection (3) shall comply with the request by giving the information to the nominated official within the period specified.

subsection.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (4) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Added 18 of 2015 s. 45)

section.name: s54
section.heading: Guidelines

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may, for the purpose of making available relevant information— (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 46)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: after consulting the system operators and settlement institutions of designated systems, issue guidelines setting out the manner in which the Monetary Authority proposes to—

subparagraph.content: discharge any duty imposed or exercise any power conferred on the Monetary Authority under this Ordinance, in so far as the duty or power relates to designated systems; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: issue guidelines setting out the manner in which the Monetary Authority proposes to—

subparagraph.content: discharge any duty imposed or exercise any power conferred on the Monetary Authority under this Ordinance, in so far as the duty or power relates to stored value facilities; or
perform any function assigned to the Monetary Authority under this Ordinance, in so far as the function relates to stored value facilities. (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 46)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may issue guidelines to—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: assist issuers or facilitators of stored value facilities to comply with the provisions of this Ordinance relating to stored value facilities. (Added 18 of 2015 s. 46)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1A)(b), the guidelines may provide that if a licensee engages in a business practice specified in the guidelines for the purposes of this subsection—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority may consider the soundness of the financial position of the licensee to be dependent on the soundness of the financial position of a single party; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority may, where the Monetary Authority is of the opinion that the case is of sufficient importance to justify the Monetary Authority to do so, consider exercising the power under Division 6 of Part 2A. (Added 18 of 2015 s. 46)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.leadIn: Guidelines issued under subsection (1B)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may be expressed to apply to all licensees or to any class of licensees; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may specify what constitutes a single party for the purposes of any of those guidelines. (Added 18 of 2015 s. 46)

subsection.name: 1D
subsection.content: Without limiting subsection (1C)(b), a class or description of persons or businesses may constitute a single party for the purposes of that subsection. (Added 18 of 2015 s. 46)

subsection.name: 1E
subsection.content: The Monetary Authority must, before exercising the power to impose a sanction mentioned in section 33Q(2)(a), issue guidelines setting out the manner in which the power is to be exercised. (Added 18 of 2015 s. 46)
The Monetary Authority shall publish in the Gazette any guidelines issued by him under this section.

section.name: s54A
section.heading: Monetary Authority may specify form

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may specify the form of any document required for the purposes of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), in specifying the form of any document, the Monetary Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: include in the form a statutory declaration to be made by the person completing the form declaring that the particulars contained in the form are true and correct to the best of the person’s knowledge and belief; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify more than one form of the document, whether as alternatives or to provide for different circumstances.

subsection.leadIn: The form of a document specified under this section must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: completed in accordance with the directions and instructions specified in the document;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by any other documents specified in the document; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: provided to the recipient in the manner (if any) specified in the document.

section.name: s55
section.heading: Systems deemed to have been designated

subsection.content: The clearing and settlement systems specified in Schedule 2 shall be deemed to have been designated for the purposes of this Ordinance under section 4(1).
It shall also be deemed that a certificate of finality has been issued in respect of each of the systems referred to in subsection (1).

section.name: s55A
section.heading: Saving provision
section.leadIn: The performance of a function under the Financial Institutions (Resolution) Ordinance (Cap. 628) has no effect on— (Amended E.R. 2 of 2017)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the designation of a clearing and settlement system that has been designated for the purposes of this Ordinance by the Monetary Authority under section 4(1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a certificate of finality issued by the Monetary Authority under section 16(3) in respect of a designated clearing and settlement system.

section.name: s56
section.heading: Service of notices

subsection.leadIn: A notice that is to be or may be given to any person by the Monetary Authority under this Ordinance is taken to have been given if it is given according to the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the notice may be delivered to him (if the person is an individual) or to any officer of the corporation (if the person is a corporation) by hand;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a place of business has been given by the person under section 6(1)(a) or 8E(3)(b), the notice may be left at that place;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if a postal address has been given by the person under section 6(1)(a) or 8E(3)(b), the notice may be sent by post to that address; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if an electronic mail address has been given by the person under section 6(1)(a) or 8E(3)(b), the notice may be sent by electronic mail transmission to that electronic mail address.

subsection.leadIn: A notice taken to have been given under subsection (1)(b), (c) or (d) shall be taken to be given, and as coming to the notice of the person to whom it is given, at the following time—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the notice is left at the place of business given under section 6(1)(a) or 8E(3)(b), when it is so left;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the notice is sent by post to the postal address given under section 6(1)(a) or 8E(3)(b), when it would in the ordinary course of post be delivered to that address; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the notice is sent by electronic mail transmission to the electronic mail address given under section 6(1)(a) or 8E(3)(b), when it would in the ordinary course of such transmission be received at that address.

subsection.content: In this section, reference to a notice being given includes reference to any notice, any document or information of any kind being given, served, sent or provided.

section.name: s56A
section.heading: Recovery of fees and expenses

subsection.leadIn: The following is recoverable from a licensee as a civil debt due to the Monetary Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a fee due and payable by the licensee under section 8M or 8N;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an amount paid by the Monetary Authority under section 8ZZ(5) for any remuneration or expenses payable by the licensee under a determination under section 8ZZ(1).

subsection.content: Any cost or expenses ordered to be paid by a person under section 33F(10) are recoverable from the person as a civil debt due to the Monetary Authority.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), an amount recoverable under this section is a debt due to the Monetary Authority within the meaning of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 265(1)(d) of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 38(1)(d) of the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6).

subsection.content: In a winding up by the Court of First Instance of a licensee, any remuneration or expenses mentioned in subsection (1)(b) payable by the licensee has the same priority as is given under rule 179(1) of the Companies (Winding-up) Rules (Cap. 32 sub. leg. H) to any costs, charges and expenses incurred by the Official Receiver appointed under section 75 of the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6).
An amount recovered under this section must be paid into the Exchange Fund established under section 3 of the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66).

section.name: s57
section.heading: Amendment of Schedules

subsection.content: The Chief Executive in Council may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 1 or 2. (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 50)
The Financial Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 or 8. (Added 18 of 2015 s. 50)

section.name: s58
section.heading: Notices, etc. as subsidiary legislation

subsection.content: A notice published in the Gazette under section 1(2), 2C, 8A(2) or 57 is subsidiary legislation for the purpose of section 34 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1). (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 51)

Except as provided in subsection (1), a notice or guideline published in the Gazette under this Ordinance is not subsidiary legislation for the purpose of section 34 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1).

section.name: s60
section.heading: Savings and transitional provisions relating to Clearing and Settlement Systems (Amendment) Ordinance 2015
section.content: Schedule 9 provides for the savings and transitional arrangements relating to the Clearing and Settlement Systems (Amendment) Ordinance 2015 (18 of 2015).

section.name: s61
section.heading: Transitional and saving provision relating to the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) (Amendment) Ordinance 2016
section.content: If a participant or the principal of a participant has passed a special resolution under section 228(1)(c) of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) before the commencement date* of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) (Amendment) Ordinance 2016 (14 of 2016) (Amendment Ordinance), the definition resolution for voluntary winding up in section 2 as in force immediately before the commencement date of the Amendment Ordinance continues to apply in relation to the participant or the principal of the participant for the purposes of this Ordinance.

part.name: P1
part.heading: Provisions Relating to Payment Systems and Stored Value Facilities Appeals Tribunal

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Schedule—
section.def: panel member (小組成員) means a member of the panel referred to in section 34(4); (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 53)
parties (各方), in relation to a review of a reviewable decision, means—(a)the applicant as defined by section 33X; and(b)the Monetary Authority; (Replaced 18 of 2015 s. 53)
Tribunal member (審裁處成員) means a member of the Tribunal appointed under section 34(2)(b). (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 53)

section.name: s2
section.heading: Tenure of Chairman of the Tribunal

subsection.content: The Chairman of the Tribunal shall be appointed for a term not exceeding 3 years.
On the expiry of his period of appointment or reappointment, the Chairman of the Tribunal is eligible for reappointment for such further term as the Chief Executive may specify.

The Chairman of the Tribunal may resign from office by giving notice in writing to the Chief Executive. A notice of resignation takes effect on the date specified in the notice or, if no date is specified, on the date of receipt by the Chief Executive of the notice.

subsection.leadIn: If the Chief Executive is satisfied that the Chairman of the Tribunal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has become bankrupt;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is incapacitated by physical or mental illness; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is otherwise unable or unfit to perform the functions of the Chairman of the Tribunal,

subsection.continued: the Chief Executive may, after consultation with the Chief Justice, declare his office as Chairman of the Tribunal to be vacant, and shall notify the fact in such manner as the Chief Executive thinks fit; and upon such declaration the office becomes vacant.

subsection.content: If a review has been commenced by the Tribunal but not completed before the expiry of the term of office of the Chairman of the Tribunal, the Chief Executive may extend the term of office of the Chairman until the completion of the review.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Tenure of panel members

subsection.content: A panel member shall be appointed for a term not exceeding 3 years.
On the expiry of his period of appointment or reappointment, a panel member is eligible for reappointment for such further term as the Chief Executive may specify.

A panel member may resign from office by giving notice in writing to the Chief Executive. A notice of resignation takes effect on the date specified in the notice or, if no date is specified, on the date of receipt by the Chief Executive of the notice.

subsection.leadIn: If the Chief Executive is satisfied that a panel member—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has become bankrupt;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is incapacitated by physical or mental illness;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is otherwise unable or unfit to perform the functions of a Tribunal member; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: has become a public officer,

subsection.continued: the Chief Executive may declare his office as panel member to be vacant, and shall notify the fact in such manner as the Chief Executive thinks fit; and upon such declaration the office becomes vacant.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Sittings

subsection.content: The Chairman of the Tribunal shall convene such sittings of the Tribunal as are necessary to determine a review.

subsection.leadIn: Before convening a sitting under subsection (1) in respect of a review, the Chairman of the Tribunal may give directions to the parties to the review concerning—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: procedural matters to be complied with by any of the parties; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the time within which such procedural matters are to be complied with.

subsection.leadIn: At a sitting of the Tribunal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Chairman of the Tribunal shall preside;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not fewer than 2 Tribunal members shall also be present; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: every question before the Tribunal shall be determined by the opinion of the majority of those referred to in paragraphs (a) and (b) except a question of law which shall be determined by the Chairman of the Tribunal alone.

subsection.content: Every sitting of the Tribunal shall be held in public unless the Tribunal, on its own motion or on the application of any of the parties to the review, determines that in the interests of justice a sitting, or any part of a sitting, shall not be held in public in which case it may hold the sitting, or the relevant part of the sitting, as the case may be, in camera.
If an application is made pursuant to subsection (4) for a determination that a sitting, or any part of a sitting, shall not be held in public, a hearing of the application shall be held in camera.

subsection.leadIn: The parties to a review shall, at any sitting of the Tribunal relating to the review, be entitled to be heard—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in person or, in the case of the Monetary Authority, through a person appointed under section 5A(3) of the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66) to assist the Monetary Authority; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: through counsel or a solicitor or, with the leave of the Tribunal, through any other person.

subsection.content: The Chairman of the Tribunal shall prepare or cause to be prepared a record of the proceedings at any sitting of the Tribunal, which shall contain such particulars relating to the proceedings as he considers appropriate.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Miscellaneous
section.leadIn: Except as otherwise provided in this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Tribunal, its Chairman and its members; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the parties to, and any witness, counsel, solicitor, or any other person involved in, a review,

section.continued: shall have the same privileges and immunities in respect of the review as they would have if the review were civil proceedings before the Court of First Instance.
