section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Schedule—
subsection.def: adequate (健全), in relation to any systems of control, includes operating the systems effectively;
chief executive (行政總裁) has the meaning given by section 8A;
controller (控權人) has the meaning given by section 8ZZE;
manager (經理) has the meaning given by section 8A;

net debit balance (借方淨差額), in relation to an applicable company, means the aggregate of—(a)the excess of the accumulated losses over the accumulated profits disclosed in the profit and loss account of the most recent audited accounts of the applicable company; and(b)other reserves separately disclosed in the balance sheet of the most recent audited accounts of the applicable company;
systems of control (管控制度) includes procedures.

subsection.content: In calculating the value of the paid-up share capital of an applicable company under this Schedule, the net debit balance of the applicable company is to be deducted from such share capital.

subsection.leadIn: In applying the criteria set out in Part 2 of this Schedule in relation to a person applying for a licence under section 8E—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a reference to a licence in a provision that defines a term or an expression used in this Schedule is a reference to the licence that may be granted to the person on an application under section 8F;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a reference to a licensee in a provision that defines a term or an expression used in this Schedule is a reference to the person; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the criteria set out in Part 2 of this Schedule are to be construed with necessary modifications to take into account the status of the person as an applicant for a licence.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Application of criteria
section.content: Unless otherwise provided in Part 2 of this Schedule, the criteria set out in that Part apply in relation to all applicable companies.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Principal business

subsection.leadIn: The principal business of the applicable company must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the issue of stored value facilities under a licence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the facilitation of the issue of stored value facilities under a licence.

subsection.content: This section does not apply in relation to an applicable company that is a bank.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Financial resources

subsection.content: The applicable company must have adequate financial resources (whether actual or contingent) for operating its SVF scheme.

subsection.leadIn: The applicable company must satisfy either of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the applicable company’s paid-up share capital is not less than—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicable company’s other financial resources are equivalent to or exceed those mentioned in paragraph (a).

subsection.content: This section does not apply in relation to an applicable company that is a bank.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Fit and proper person

subsection.content: The applicable company must have in place adequate systems of control to ensure that the Monetary Authority is kept informed of the identity of each controller of the applicable company.
Each chief executive, director or controller of the applicable company must be a fit and proper person to hold the position concerned.
The applicable company must have in place adequate systems of control to ensure that each manager of the applicable company is a fit and proper person to hold the position concerned.
This section does not apply in relation to an applicable company that is a bank.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Knowledge and experience

subsection.content: The officers of the applicable company who are responsible for implementing the company’s SVF scheme or the day-to-day management of the scheme must have the appropriate knowledge and experience to effectively discharge that responsibility.

The applicable company must have in place adequate systems of control to ensure that each of its officers responsible for implementing the company’s SVF scheme or the day-to-day management of the scheme has the appropriate knowledge and experience to effectively discharge that responsibility.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Prudential and risk management

subsection.leadIn: The applicable company must have in place appropriate risk management policies and procedures for managing the risks arising from the operation of its SVF scheme that are commensurate with the scale and complexity of the scheme, including—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: adequate security and internal control to ensure the safety and integrity of data (in particular, personal data) and records;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: effective means to detect fraud and attempted fraud;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: robust and proven contingency arrangements to address any operational disruptions; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: other operational and security safeguards appropriate for the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: The applicable company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must implement the policies and procedures mentioned in subsection (1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must not deviate from those policies and procedures except with the prior written consent of the Monetary Authority.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Anti-money laundering and counter-terrorist financing measures

subsection.content: There must be in place in the SVF scheme of the applicable company adequate and appropriate systems of control for preventing or combating possible money laundering or terrorist financing.

subsection.leadIn: The applicable company must have in place adequate and appropriate systems of control to ensure that it complies with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the provisions of the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorist Financing Ordinance (Cap. 615) that are applicable to the applicable company; and (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 49)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the measures (if any) promulgated by the Monetary Authority, whether in the form of rules, regulations, guidelines or otherwise, to prevent, combat or detect money laundering or terrorist financing.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Management of float and SVF deposit
section.leadIn: If the applicable company holds the float or SVF deposit of a stored value facility to which its SVF scheme relates, the applicable company must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: have in place adequate risk management policies and procedures for managing the float or deposit to ensure that there will always be sufficient funds for the redemption of the stored value that remains on the facility;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: implement those policies and procedures; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: ensure that at all times the float or deposit—

subparagraph.content: is kept separate from any other funds paid to or maintained or received by the applicable company; and
is adequately protected by the measures adopted by the applicable company for protecting the float or deposit.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Redemption of outstanding stored value

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), if the applicable company holds the stored value (including SVF deposit) of a stored value facility to which its SVF scheme relates, the applicable company must redeem in full the total of the stored value that remains on the facility as soon as practicable after being requested by its user to do so.

For the purposes of subsection (1), if a fee or charge is payable for a request for the redemption made at any time, the applicable company must, in the contract with the user, state clearly and prominently the amount of the fee or charge.

The Monetary Authority may, on the application of the applicable company, give a prior written permission to the applicable company to the effect that its SVF scheme is not to be subject to subsection (1), if the Monetary Authority considers it appropriate to do so.

subsection.leadIn: If a prior written permission is given under subsection (3), the applicable company must, in the contract with the user, state clearly and prominently—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the stored value remaining on the stored value facility is not redeemable after an expiry date;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the expiry date for redeeming the stored value remaining on the facility; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other terms or conditions relating to the redemption.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Operating rules
section.content: The operating rules of the SVF scheme of the applicable company must be prudent and sound, having regard to the purposes of the scheme and how the scheme is to be operated and governed.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Purpose and soundness of relevant scheme

subsection.content: The SVF scheme of the applicable company must be prudent and sound, having regard to the purpose, business model and operational arrangement of the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: The SVF scheme of the applicable company must be operated prudently and with competence in a manner that will not adversely affect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the stability of any payment system in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the interests of the user or potential user of the stored value facility to which the SVF scheme relates.

controller (控權人) has the meaning given by section 8ZZE.

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: In this Schedule, a licensee is regarded as insolvent if the licensee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has ceased to pay its debts in the ordinary course of business; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: cannot pay its debts as they become due.

section.name: s3
section.content: The Monetary Authority is satisfied that the licensee does not fulfil any of the minimum criteria applicable in relation to the licensee.

section.name: s4
section.leadIn: The Monetary Authority is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the licensee—

subparagraph.content: proposes to enter into, or has entered into, a voluntary arrangement as defined by section 2 of the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6) with its creditors;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the licensee is insolvent; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the licensee is being, or has been, wound up or is otherwise dissolved.

section.name: s5
section.leadIn: The licensee has informed the Monetary Authority that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is likely to become unable to meet its obligations; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is about to suspend payment.

section.name: s6
section.content: The Monetary Authority is satisfied that the licensee is unable to meet its obligations or has suspended payment.

section.name: s7
section.leadIn: The Monetary Authority is satisfied that the licensee has not provided the Monetary Authority (whether before, on or after the grant of the licence) with any information required to be provided under this Ordinance that is of a material nature relating to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the licensee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any circumstances likely to affect the licensee’s method of business.

section.name: s8
section.content: The Monetary Authority is satisfied that the licensee has provided the Monetary Authority (whether before, on or after the grant of the licence) with any information (whether or not provided under this Ordinance) that is false, misleading or inaccurate in a material particular.

section.name: s9
section.content: The Monetary Authority is satisfied that the licensee has contravened a condition of the licence attached under section 8I.

section.name: s10
section.content: The Monetary Authority is satisfied that the licensee has ceased to carry on the business of issuing or facilitating the issue of stored value facilities.

section.name: s11
section.content: The licensee has failed to pay the fee required by section 8M or 8N after being advised in writing by the Monetary Authority that the licensee has failed to pay the fee.

section.name: s12
section.content: A person has become a controller of the licensee despite there being in effect a notice given to the person under section 8ZZF(2)(b) objecting to the person becoming such a controller.

section.name: s13
section.content: A person continues to be a controller of the licensee despite there being in effect a notice given to the person under section 8ZZG(3)(b) or 8ZZJ(2) objecting to the person being such a controller.

section.name: s14
section.content: The licensee is in contravention of section 8ZZU.

section.name: s15
section.content: A person has become or continues to be a chief executive or director of the licensee in contravention of section 8ZZV.

section.name: s16
section.content: The licensee engages in a business practice specified in the guidelines issued under section 54(1B).

section.name: s17
section.content: The Monetary Authority is satisfied that the interests of the user or potential user of any stored value facility issued, or the issue of which is facilitated, by the licensee under its licence are in any manner threatened by the licensee continuing to be licensed.

section.name: s18
section.content: The Monetary Authority is satisfied that the licensee engages in business practices which would be likely to prejudice the interests of Hong Kong as an international financial centre.

section.name: s19
section.content: The licensee has failed to pay any pecuniary penalty required to be paid by it under section 33Q after being advised in writing by the Monetary Authority that the period within which the penalty was required to be paid has expired without the penalty being paid.

section.name: s20
section.content: The licensee requests in writing the Monetary Authority to revoke the licence, and the Monetary Authority is satisfied that the interests of the user of any stored value facility issued, or the issue of which is facilitated, by the licensee under its licence will be adequately safeguarded even if the request is acceded to.

section.name: s8
section.content: Power to give guarantees in the name of, or on behalf of, the licensee concerned.

section.name: s9
section.content: Power to refer to arbitration any question affecting the licensee concerned.

section.name: s10
section.content: Power to take out and maintain any insurance in respect of the business or property of the licensee concerned.

section.name: s11
section.content: Power to use the seal (if any) of the licensee concerned.

section.name: s12
section.content: Power to do all acts for executing in the name of, or on behalf of, the licensee concerned any deed, receipt or other document, including power to enter into, carry out, assign or accept the assignment of, vary or rescind, any contract, agreement or other obligation.

section.name: s13
section.content: Power to draw, accept, make and endorse any bill of exchange or promissory note in the name of, or on behalf of, the licensee concerned.

section.name: s14
section.content: Power to appoint an agent to do any business which the Manager is unable to do personally or which can more conveniently be done by an agent, and power to employ, direct and dismiss employees.

section.name: s15
section.content: Power to do all acts that may be necessary for the realization of any property of the licensee concerned, including power to carry out works.

section.name: s16
section.content: Power to make payment that is necessary or incidental to the discharge of the Manager’s duties or the exercise of the Manager’s powers.

section.name: s17
section.content: Power to carry on any business of the licensee concerned.

section.name: s18
section.content: Power to grant or accept a surrender of a lease or tenancy of any property of the licensee concerned, and to take a lease or tenancy of any property required or convenient for the business of the licensee.

section.name: s19
section.content: Power to make any arrangement or compromise on behalf of the licensee concerned.

section.name: s20
section.content: Power to call up any uncalled capital of the licensee concerned.

section.name: s21
section.content: Power to rank and claim in the bankruptcy, insolvency, sequestration or liquidation of a person indebted to the licensee concerned, and to receive dividends, and to accede to trust deeds for the creditors of any such person.

section.name: s22
section.content: Power to change the location of any business office of the licensee concerned.

section.name: s23
section.content: Power to do all other acts that are incidental to the exercise of the powers set out in this Schedule.

schedule.name: sch8
schedule.heading: Stored Value Facilities Exempt from Divisions 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 and 9 of Part 2A

section.name: s1
section.heading: Stored value facilities used for certain cash reward schemes
section.leadIn: A stored value facility is one specified for the purposes of section 8ZZZB if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: it may be used for storing only a sum of money paid by—

subparagraph.content: the issuer; or
a person who agrees to pay a sum of money for storage in the facility under an agreement with the issuer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the sum of money stored may only be used for making payments for goods or services provided by the issuer or person under the terms and conditions of the facility.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Stored value facilities used for purchasing certain digital products
section.leadIn: A stored value facility is one specified for the purposes of section 8ZZZB if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the payments are executed through such a device; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the telecommunication, digital or IT operator does not act only as an intermediary between the user of the facility and the provider of the goods or services.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Stored value facilities used for certain bonus point schemes
section.leadIn: A stored value facility is one specified for the purposes of section 8ZZZB if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: subject to paragraph (b)(ii), it may be used for storing only points or units (by whatever name called) that are money’s worth provided by—

subparagraph.content: the issuer; or
a person who agrees to provide goods or services to the user of the facility under an agreement with the issuer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the user may use the points or units for making payments for the goods or services provided by the issuer or person either by—

subparagraph.content: using only the points or units; or
using the points or units together with a sum of money (in any currency) that is stored on the facility temporarily for the sole purpose of executing the payments; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the sum of money so stored is not redeemable for cash.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Stored value facilities used within limited group of goods or services providers

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), a stored value facility is one specified for the purposes of section 8ZZZB if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: it may be used as a means of making payments only for goods or services provided by—

subparagraph.content: the issuer; or
a person who provides the goods or services under an agreement with the issuer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it may be so used within only any of the premises occupied by the issuer.

subsection.leadIn: The stored value facility is not one so specified if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount of the float of the facility exceeds $1,000,000 or its equivalent; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the issuer issues more than one such facility, the aggregate amount of the float of those facilities exceeds $1,000,000 or its equivalent.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Stored value facilities used within certain premises

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), a stored value facility is one specified for the purposes of section 8ZZZB if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is issued under an agreement between the issuer and another person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it may be used as a means of making payments only for goods or services within any of the premises occupied by that other person.

subsection.leadIn: The stored value facility is not one so specified if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount of the float of the facility exceeds $1,000,000 or its equivalent; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the issuer issues more than one such facility, the aggregate amount of the float of those facilities exceeds $1,000,000 or its equivalent.

schedule.name: sch9
schedule.heading: Savings and Transitional Provisions Relating to Clearing and Settlement Systems (Amendment) Ordinance 2015

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Schedule—
section.def: amending Ordinance (《修訂條例》) means the Clearing and Settlement Systems (Amendment) Ordinance 2015 (18 of 2015);
new Tribunal (新審裁處) means the Payment Systems and Stored Value Facilities Appeals Tribunal established under section 34(1) of this Ordinance;
old Tribunal (舊審裁處) means the Clearing and Settlement Systems Appeals Tribunal established under section 34(1) of the pre-amended Ordinance;
pre-amended Ordinance (《原有條例》) means the Clearing and Settlement Systems Ordinance (Cap. 584) as in force immediately before the appointed day.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Chairman of old Tribunal

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was appointed to be the Chairman of the old Tribunal under section 34(3) of the pre-amended Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: holds the office immediately before the appointed date.

subsection.content: On the appointed date, the person continues to hold the office of the Chairman of the new Tribunal under section 34(3) of this Ordinance on the same terms and conditions that were applicable to the appointment had the amending Ordinance not been enacted.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Panel members

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was appointed to be a member of the panel mentioned in section 34(4) of the pre-amended Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: holds the office immediately before the appointed date.

subsection.content: On the appointed date, the person continues to hold the office of the member of the panel mentioned in section 34(4) of this Ordinance on the same terms and conditions that were applicable to the appointment had the amending Ordinance not been enacted.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Gazette notices and related matters under pre-amended Ordinance

subsection.content: On and after the appointed day, a notice published in the Gazette under section 4(1) of the pre-amended Ordinance continues to have effect and is regarded to have been published under section 4(1)(a) of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: On and after the appointed day—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an exemption granted under section 11(2) or (3) of the pre-amended Ordinance continues to have effect and is regarded as an exemption granted under section 11(2) or (3) of this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a notice published in the Gazette under section 11(4) of the pre-amended Ordinance in relation to the exemption continues to have effect and is regarded to have been published under section 11(4) of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: On and after the appointed day—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a certificate issued under section 16(3) of the pre-amended Ordinance continues to have effect and is regarded to have been issued under section 16(3) of this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a notice published in the Gazette under section 16(7) of the pre-amended Ordinance in relation to the certificate continues to have effect and is regarded to have been published under section 16(7) of this Ordinance.

subsection.content: On and after the appointed day, a notice published in the Gazette under section 28(4) of the pre-amended Ordinance continues to have effect and is regarded to have been published under section 28(4) of this Ordinance.

On and after the appointed day, a notice published in the Gazette under section 29(4) of the pre-amended Ordinance continues to have effect and is regarded to have been published under section 29(4) of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: In the notice mentioned in subsection (1), (2)(b), (3)(b), (4) or (5)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to Division 3 of Part 2 of the pre-amended Ordinance is to be construed as a reference to Part 2B of this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference in any other provision of the pre-amended Ordinance is to be construed as a reference to the corresponding provision of this Ordinance.
